analyzed: de'i 'og zur la gnas pa'i sna tshhogs pad+ma'i steng du sna tshhogs rdo rje dang bcas pa rnams so/_/rdo rje de'i phyogs kyi rtshibs rnams sbyor ba ji lta bar rnam par snang
translated: vajras.🔽The spokes of the vajra are the colors of Vairocana and so forth,

analyzed: mdzad la sogs pa lta bu'i mdog can ste/_dbus kyi lte ba yang de bzhin no/_/

analyzed: der rin po che kha dog lnga las yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzhal yas khang thub pa'i

analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'od zer sna tshhogs kyis phyogs kun gyi 'khor lo khyab par byas pa'o//

analyzed: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i

analyzed: gzugs can/_gur gum lta bur dmar ser/_g.yas dang g.yon gyi zhal nag

analyzed: po dang dkar po/_rtsha ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la

analyzed: mkhyud pa/_ral gri dang /_mda' dang /_ud pal dang /_gzhu 'dzin pa/

analyzed: rin po che'i cod pan can/_rin po che sna tshhogs pa la sogs pas brgyan pa/

analyzed: 'od zer mtha' yas pa'o/_/de'i shar phyogs su rnam par snang mdzad dkar po/

analyzed: g.yas dang g.yon gyi zhal nag po dang dmar po'o/_/phyag rnams na 'khor lo

analyzed: rtshibs brgyad pa dkar po dang /_ral gri dang /_nor bu dang /_pad+ma 'dzin pa'o//

analyzed: lho'i phyogs su rin chen 'byung ldan ser po/_phyag rnams ni nor bu ra ga ta zur

analyzed: g.yas g.yon gyi zhal nag po dang dkar po'o/_/de ba 'di dag rin po che'i cod

analyzed: pan dang ldan pa/_rin po che sna tshhogs kyis brgyan pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su
translated: They all have jeweled crowns and are adorned with various jewels.🔽In the southeast is white Vairocana, with a wheel, gem, lotus, and sword in his four hands.

original: spyan ma rnam snang dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/srin por ma ma ki mi bskyod pa dang mtshhungs pa ni ud pa la dmar po dang /_ral gri dang /_nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin

original: pa ste/_sgrub pa'i thabs thams cad las bshad pa'i phyir ro/_/rlung gi🔽mtshhams su gos dkar mo snang ba mtha' yas dang mtshhungs so/_/dbang ldan du

analyzed: sgrol ma rin chen 'byung ldan dang mtshhungs pa ud pa la ser po dang ral gri dang / nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/nang gi rim pa las phyi rol me'i mtshhams su

original: gzugs rdo rje ma rnam par snang mdzad dang mtshhungs pa/_rin po che'i me long
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma rnam par snang mdzad dang mtshhungs pa/_rin po che'i me long
translated: Outside the inner enclosure, in the southeast, Rūpavajrā is the same as Vairocana, holding a jeweled mirror,

original: dang ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/srin por sgra rdo rje mi bskyod pa
analyzed: dang ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/srin por sgra rdo rje mi bskyod pa
translated: a sword, a gem, and a lotus. In the southwest, Śabdavajrā is the same as Akṣobhya, holding a double-headed drum,🔽a sword, a gem, and a lotus. In the northwest, Gandhavajrā is the same as Ratnasaṃbhava, holding a conch,🔽a sword, a gem, and a lotus. In the northeast, Rasavajrā is the same as Amoghasiddhi, holding a golden wheel,🔽a sword, a gem, and a lotus.

original: dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/tam bu ra sngon po dang ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin🔽pa'o/_/rlung du dri rdo rje ma rin chen 'byung ldan dang mtshhungs pa/_dri chab kyi

translated: She holds a yellow conch shell filled with perfume and a sword, chakram, and lotus.🔽In the northeast, Rasavajrā is similar to Amitābha.🔽She holds a red skull cup filled with nectar and a sword, jewel, and chakram.

original: gri dang nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgo'i g.yon phyogs su reg rdo rje
analyzed: gri dang nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgo'i g.yon phyogs su reg rdo rje

original: ma don yod grub pa dang mtshhungs pa/_gos sna tshhogs dang ral gri dang nor bu
analyzed: ma don yod grub pa dang mtshhungs pa/_gos sna tshhogs dang ral gri dang nor bu
translated: She holds multicolored cloth, a sword, jewel, and lotus.

original: dang /_pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgo'i g.yas phyogs su chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje
analyzed: dang /_pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgo'i g.yas phyogs su chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje
translated: To the right of the eastern gate, Dharmadhātuvajrā is similar to Akṣobhya.

original: ma rdo rje sems dpa' dang mtshhungs pa/_chos 'byung dkar po dang ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/'jam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha 'di dag ni
analyzed: ma rdo rje sems dpa' dang mtshhungs pa/_chos 'byung dkar po dang ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/'jam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha 'di dag ni
translated: The mother is similar to Vajrasattva, holding a white source of phenomena, a sword, a gem, and a lotus.

original: zhal gsum pa/_phyag drug pa/_dang po'i phyag mtshhan gnyis g.yas pa gnyis
analyzed: zhal gsum pa/_phyag drug pa/_dang po'i phyag mtshhan gnyis g.yas pa gnyis
translated: These deities, beginning with Manjushri Vajra, have three faces, six arms, and two principal hands.

original: kyis 'dzin pa/_gzhan gnyis pa gnyis ni g.yon pa gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: kyis 'dzin pa/_gzhan gnyis pa gnyis ni g.yon pa gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: The first two hands hold the first two implements, and the other two hands hold the other two implements.

original: thams cad rtsha ba'i zhal sku dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgo ru🔽gshin rje mthar byed dang /_shes rab mthar byed dang pad+ma mthar byed dang / bgegs mthar byed rnams so/_/'dir 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang rnam par snang
analyzed: thams cad rtsha ba'i zhal sku dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgo ru gshin rje mthar byed dang /_shes rab mthar byed dang pad+ma mthar byed dang / bgegs mthar byed rnams so/_/'dir 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang rnam par snang
translated: All of them have wrathful faces and bodies that are similar to their principal faces.🔽Yamântaka, Prajnantam, Padmantam, and Vighnantam are in the east and other directions.

original: mdzad dang lha mo bcu po 'di rnams ni zla ba'i dal la rdo rje'i dkyil dkrung gis
analyzed: mdzad dang lha mo bcu po 'di rnams ni zla ba'i dal la rdo rje'i dkyil dkrung gis
translated: Here, Manjushri Vajra, Vairochana, and the ten goddesses are on the moon mandala in the vajra posture.

original: bzhugs pa ste/_gzhan rnams ni nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/_/zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'og tu sna tshhogs pad+ma'o/_/de ba rnams ni rtsha ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang
analyzed: bzhugs pa ste/_gzhan rnams ni nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/_/zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'og tu sna tshhogs pad+ma'o/_/de ba rnams ni rtsha ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang
translated: The male deities have their right hands in the gesture of supreme giving and their left hands in the gesture of meditative equipoise.🔽The male deities embrace their consorts, who are similar to themselves, and the goddesses also embrace their male counterparts.

original: dang mtshhungs pa'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa ste/_lha mo rnams kyang rang dang mtshhungs pa'i thabs la mkhyud pa'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po ni dbu la dgod do/_/🔽de'ang 'jam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i de ba rnams la/_ma ma ki dang /_sgra🔽rdo rje ma dang bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i khro bo brgyad rnams la ni mi bskyod pa'o/_/🔽spyan ma dang gzugs rdo rje ma dang gshin rje gshed byed rnams la ni rnam par snang
analyzed: dang mtshhungs pa'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa ste/_lha mo rnams kyang rang dang mtshhungs pa'i thabs la mkhyud pa'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po ni dbu la dgod do/_/ de'ang 'jam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i de ba rnams la/_ma ma ki dang /_sgra rdo rje ma dang bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i khro bo brgyad rnams la ni mi bskyod pa'o/_/ spyan ma dang gzugs rdo rje ma dang gshin rje gshed byed rnams la ni rnam par snang
translated: The heads of the male deities are crowned with the heads of the lords of their respective families.🔽The male deities such as Manjushri Vajra are crowned with Amoghasiddhi, Locana with Akshobhya, Mamaki and Tara with Vairochana, Pandaravasini with Ratnasambhava, and the eight wrathful guardians of the protection wheel with Akshobhya.

original: mdzad do/_/dri rdo rje ma la rin chen 'byung ldan no/_/gos dkar mo dang ro
analyzed: mdzad do/_/dri rdo rje ma la rin chen 'byung ldan no/_/gos dkar mo dang ro
translated: Locana, Rupavajra, and Yamantaka are crowned with Vairochana, Gandhavajra with Ratnasambhava, and Pundarika with Amitabha.

original: rdo rje ma dang pad+ma mthar byed rnams la 'od dpag med do/_/chos kyi dbyings kyi
analyzed: rdo rje ma dang pad+ma mthar byed rnams la 'od dpag med do/_/chos kyi dbyings kyi
translated: Vajra woman and Padmanateśvara have Amitābha.🔽Dharmadhātvāyatanavajra woman also has Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje ma la'ang rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/gzhan gyi lugs la ni mi bskyod pa'i zhes
analyzed: rdo rje ma la'ang rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/gzhan gyi lugs la ni mi bskyod pa'i zhes
translated: In other systems, it is asserted that she has Akṣobhya.

original: 'dod do/_/rdo rje sems dpa' ni sku mdog dkar po la yid tsham dmar ba'i
analyzed: 'dod do/_/rdo rje sems dpa' ni sku mdog dkar po la yid tsham dmar ba'i
translated: Vajrasattva is white in color, with a reddish glow of passion,

original: mdangs dang ldan pa/_g.yas dang g.yon gyi zhal ni sngon po dang dmar po'o/_/
analyzed: mdangs dang ldan pa/_g.yas dang g.yon gyi zhal ni sngon po dang dmar po'o/_/
translated: with a blue face to the right and a red face to the left.

original: phyag dang po gnyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/_phyag lhag ma🔽dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: phyag dang po gnyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/_phyag lhag ma dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The first two hands embrace a wisdom consort similar to himself, and the remaining🔽hands hold a blue vajra, a sword, a gem, and a lotus.

original: rnams kyis rdo rje sngon po dang /_ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa/_sna
analyzed: rnams kyis rdo rje sngon po dang /_ral gri dang nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa/_sna
translated: The Garland of Yoga Perfections, a Sādhana for All Maṇḍalas

original: tshhogs pad+ma dang zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa/_zla ba lta bu'i mdog can/
analyzed: tshhogs pad+ma dang zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa/_zla ba lta bu'i mdog can/
translated: He sits on a multicolored lotus and moon seat, with a complexion like the moon.

original: skyil krung dang rin po che'i cod pan can/_rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/
analyzed: skyil krung dang rin po che'i cod pan can/_rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/
translated: He sits cross-legged, with a jeweled crown and is adorned with jeweled ornaments.

original: dbu la mi bskyod rdo rjes rgyas btab pa'o/_/'dir 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i thugs kha
analyzed: dbu la mi bskyod rdo rjes rgyas btab pa'o/_/'dir 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i thugs kha
translated: Akṣobhya Vajra seals his head.

original: ste/_nu ma gnyis kyi bar du dam tshhig sems dpa' lta bu'i ye shes sems dpa'o//
analyzed: ste/_nu ma gnyis kyi bar du dam tshhig sems dpa' lta bu'i ye shes sems dpa'o//
translated: Here, Mañjuvajra is the gnosis being, like the commitment being, between the two breasts.

original: de'i snying khar zla ba la ral gri'i yu ba la zla bas mtshhan pa la sa bon mam mo/_/🔽rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag med dang don
analyzed: de'i snying khar zla ba la ral gri'i yu ba la zla bas mtshhan pa la sa bon mam mo/_/ rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag med dang don
translated: In his heart, on a moon is a sword handle marked with a moon, on which is the seed syllable maṃ.🔽Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, and Akṣobhya have their own hand implements marked with moon and sun on which are the seed syllables oṃ, jriṃ, khaṃ, hūṃ, and hūṃ.

original: yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams kyi thugs khar rang gi phyag mtshhan zla ba dang nyi mas mtshhan pa la bru om dzi kham hum ngo /_/spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams la mo
analyzed: yod grub pa dang mi bskyod pa rnams kyi thugs khar rang gi phyag mtshhan zla ba dang nyi mas mtshhan pa la bru om dzi kham hum ngo /_/spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams la mo
translated: For Locanā and so forth, the seed syllables are mo, laṃ, maṃ, paṃ, and taṃ.🔽For the wrathful ones, the seed syllable is hūṃ.

original: lo tam/_dza hu~m ba~m ho kham ram mo/_/khro bo rnams ni hum ngo /_/lha thams cad kyi snying
analyzed: lo tam/_dza hu~m ba~m ho kham ram mo/_/khro bo rnams ni hum ngo /_/lha thams cad kyi snying
translated: The seed syllables of all the deities are in the heart.

original: po'i sngags ni rdo rje phreng ba las bstan to/_/'dir rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor la
analyzed: po'i sngags ni rdo rje phreng ba las bstan to/_/'dir rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor la
translated: The mantra of the principal deity is taught in the Vajra Garland.

original: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang /_ye shes sems dpa' dgug gzhug🔽la sogs pa ni ma gsungs so/_/de dag med kyang spyan lnga dang mngon par shes🔽pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshhogs dpag du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pas
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang /_ye shes sems dpa' dgug gzhug la sogs pa ni ma gsungs so/_/de dag med kyang spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshhogs dpag du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pas
translated: Here, in the completion yoga, the consecration of the eyes and so forth and🔽the invocation and absorption of the wisdom-being are not taught.

original: mdzes par byas pa'i sku yi dam gyi lha gcig char du nyid du legs par yongs su dag
analyzed: mdzes par byas pa'i sku yi dam gyi lha gcig char du nyid du legs par yongs su dag
translated: Even without those, the body of the deity is beautified with an immeasurable and inconceivable collection of good qualities such as the five eyes and the superknowledges.

original: pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te/_yang dang yang du lhag🔽par mos pa brtan pa'i phyir ro/_/snying po'i sngags la sogs pa ni bum pa lhag
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te/_yang dang yang du lhag par mos pa brtan pa'i phyir ro/_/snying po'i sngags la sogs pa ni bum pa lhag
translated: The deity is completely pure and all aspects are completely perfect,🔽because of the firm conviction that is repeatedly generated.

original: par gnas pa la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i ched du'o/_/gang gi tshhe dbus de ba
analyzed: par gnas pa la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i ched du'o/_/gang gi tshhe dbus de ba
translated: The essence mantra and so forth are used for the sake of applying the vase consecration and so forth.

original: gzhan bdag por gyur pa de'i tshhe dbus kyi gtsho bo gang gis byed pa de gnas par
analyzed: gzhan bdag por gyur pa de'i tshhe dbus kyi gtsho bo gang gis byed pa de gnas par
translated: When the central part is the lord of the others, then the central part is made by whatever is the lord.

original: 'gyur ro/_/'od dpag med kyang dkar por 'gyur te/_chos rnams dkar
analyzed: 'gyur ro/_/'od dpag med kyang dkar por 'gyur te/_chos rnams dkar
translated: And Amitābha would become white, and all phenomena would become white.🔽

original: po'i rang bzhin gyis/_/'di ni ngag gi dbang phyug dkar/_/ces gsungs
analyzed: po'i rang bzhin gyis/_/'di ni ngag gi dbang phyug dkar/_/ces gsungs
translated: Also, Amitābha would become white, because it is said, “Since phenomena are the nature of white, this is the white lord of speech.”🔽Here it is said:

original: pas so/_/'dir brjod pa/_'chad par 'gyur ba'i dal rnams la/_gang
analyzed: pas so/_/'dir brjod pa/_'chad par 'gyur ba'i dal rnams la/_gang
translated: “In the maṇḍalas that will be explained,🔽the locations of the deities of the maṇḍala

original: dal 'khor lo'i lha rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa rnams brjod par bya ste/_de la
analyzed: dal 'khor lo'i lha rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa rnams brjod par bya ste/_de la

analyzed: rnams kyi snang ba mtha' yas so/_/sgrol ma dang /_ro rdo rje ma dang /_reg rdo rje ma dang /_sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang /_bgegs mthar byed dang / stobs po che rnams kyi don yod grub pa'o zhes shes par bya'o//_// dpal kun tu kha sbyor du gsungs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' pa'i dal du/
translated: Avalokiteśvara, Vighnāntaka, and Mahābala.🔽In the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva taught in the glorious Compendium of Principles,🔽in the center of the protection wheel inside the Vajra Tent,

original: rdo rje gur gyi nang du bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i lte ba'i nang na/_me dang /_rlung
analyzed: rdo rje gur gyi nang du bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i lte ba'i nang na/_me dang /_rlung
translated: there is fire and wind

original: dang chu dang /_sa'i dal dang /_ri rab kyi steng chos 'byung gi dkyil du
analyzed: dang chu dang /_sa'i dal dang /_ri rab kyi steng chos 'byung gi dkyil du
translated: The celestial palace is in the center of the phenomena source on top of Mount Meru.

original: gzhal yas khang ngo /_/bsrung ba'i 'khor lo gshin rje gshed phyag g.yas pa
analyzed: gzhal yas khang ngo /_/bsrung ba'i 'khor lo gshin rje gshed phyag g.yas pa
translated: The protection wheel is Yamantaka with three right hands

original: gsum gyis dang po rdo rje gnyis pa lcags kyu dang gsum pa 'khor lo dang rdo rje rnams
analyzed: gsum gyis dang po rdo rje gnyis pa lcags kyu dang gsum pa 'khor lo dang rdo rje rnams
translated: holding a vajra, a goad, and a wheel and vajra, and three left hands🔽holding a lasso with a threatening forefinger, a bell, and an axe.🔽Prajña­cakra has a lasso, a vajra, a sword, a threatening forefinger at the heart, a bell, an axe, and a lasso.

analyzed: 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gsum gyis sdigs 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang / dril bu dang /_dgra sta 'dzin pa'o/_/shes rab mthar byed ni zhags pa dang / rdo rje dang /_ral gri dang /_snying khar sdigs mdzub dang /_dril bu dang / dgra sta dang /_zhags pa'o/_/pad+ma mthar byed lcags sgrog dang /_pad+ma dang / ral gri dang /_dril bu dang /_dgra sta dang zhags pa'o/_/bgegs mthar
translated: Padmaṇtaka has a chain, a lotus, a sword, a bell, an axe, and a lasso.

original: byed ni rdo rje dril bu dang /_sna tshhogs rdo rje dang /_'khor lo dang /_sdigs
analyzed: byed ni rdo rje dril bu dang /_sna tshhogs rdo rje dang /_'khor lo dang /_sdigs
translated: Vighnantaka has a vajra and bell, a crossed vajra, a wheel, a threatening forefinger,🔽an axe, and a lasso.

original: 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang gtun shing dang dgra sta 'dzin pa'o/_/mi🔽g.yo ba ni ral gri dang 'khor lo dang /_rdo rje rnams dang /_sdigs 'dzub
analyzed: 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang gtun shing dang dgra sta 'dzin pa'o/_/mi g.yo ba ni ral gri dang 'khor lo dang /_rdo rje rnams dang /_sdigs 'dzub
translated: He holds a lasso, a pestle, and a battle-ax in his remaining hands.🔽Acala holds a sword, a chakram, and a vajra in his three right hands and makes a threatening gesture, holds a battle-ax, and holds a lasso in his three left hands.

original: dang /_dgra sta dang /_zhags pa'o/_/'dod pa'i rgyal po ni g.yas pa dang / g.yon pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje hum mdzad kyi phyag rgya dang /_lcags kyu dang /🔽ral gri dang /_rdo rje dang /_zhags pa'o/_/dbyug pa sngon po ni rdo rjes
analyzed: dang /_dgra sta dang /_zhags pa'o/_/'dod pa'i rgyal po ni g.yas pa dang / g.yon pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje hum mdzad kyi phyag rgya dang /_lcags kyu dang / ral gri dang /_rdo rje dang /_zhags pa'o/_/dbyug pa sngon po ni rdo rjes
translated: The King of Desire holds a vajra-fist mudra and a hook in his two right hands and a sword, a vajra, and a lasso in his two left hands.

original: mtshhan pa'i dbyug pa dang ral gri dang 'khor lo rnams dang /_snying khar sdigs🔽'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang /_pad+ma dang /_dgra sta'o/_/stobs po🔽che ni rtshe gsum dang /_ral gri dang /_'khor lo dang /_snying khar sdigs
analyzed: mtshhan pa'i dbyug pa dang ral gri dang 'khor lo rnams dang /_snying khar sdigs 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang /_pad+ma dang /_dgra sta'o/_/stobs po che ni rtshe gsum dang /_ral gri dang /_'khor lo dang /_snying khar sdigs
translated: Niladanda holds a club marked with a vajra, a sword, and a chakram in his three right hands and makes a threatening gesture, holds a lasso, and holds a lotus and a battle-ax in his three left hands.

original: 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang /_pad+ma dang /_dgra sta rnams so/_/
analyzed: 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang /_pad+ma dang /_dgra sta rnams so/_/
translated: Mahabala holds a trident, a sword, and a chakram in his three right hands and makes a threatening gesture, holds a lasso, and holds a lotus and a battle-ax in his three left hands.

original: gtshug tor 'khor lo bsgyur ba'i ni g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i phyag dang po gnyis
analyzed: gtshug tor 'khor lo bsgyur ba'i ni g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i phyag dang po gnyis
translated: For Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin, the first right and left hands

analyzed: kyis spyi bor gtshug tor 'khor lo bsgyur ba'i phyag rgya dang /_'khor lo dang / pad+ma dang /_sdigs 'dzub dang /_ral gri'o/_/gnod mdzes ni rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang /_snying khar sdigs 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang /_pad+ma dang /_ral gri'o/_/bcu po 'di dag ni dbu la thod pa lngas
translated: form the uṣṇīṣa cakravartin mudra at the crown, and hold a wheel, lotus, threatening forefinger, and sword. For Sumbha, the hands hold a vajra, wheel, jewel, lasso with a threatening forefinger at the heart, lotus, and sword.🔽These ten have five skulls

original: brgyan pa/_'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa/_mi mgo'i phreng ba
analyzed: brgyan pa/_'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa/_mi mgo'i phreng ba
translated: on their heads, are adorned with the five symbolic ornaments of wheel and so forth, and wear a garland of human heads.

original: ske la 'chang ba rnams go rims bzhin du steng dang phyogs su gnas pa rnams la mi🔽bskyod pa dang /_rnam snang dang /_rin chen 'byung ldan dang /_'od dpag
analyzed: ske la 'chang ba rnams go rims bzhin du steng dang phyogs su gnas pa rnams la mi bskyod pa dang /_rnam snang dang /_rin chen 'byung ldan dang /_'od dpag
translated: They are in the upper and directional directions, respectively.🔽Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha,

original: med dang /_don yod grub pa dang /_yang 'og dang mtshhams na gnas pa
analyzed: med dang /_don yod grub pa dang /_yang 'og dang mtshhams na gnas pa
translated: Amoghasiddhi, and Sumbha are in the lower and intermediate directions.

analyzed: rnams la ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang /_'od dpag
translated: The others are marked with the seals of Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha,

original: med dang /_don yod grub pa dang /_mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgyas brtag pa'o/_/
analyzed: med dang /_don yod grub pa dang /_mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgyas brtag pa'o/_/
translated: Amoghasiddhi, and Akṣobhya.

original: gzhal yas khang gi lto ba'i dbus su rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dzum pa dang bcas
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi lto ba'i dbus su rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dzum pa dang bcas
translated: In the center of the interior of the celestial palace, Vajrasattva has three

original: pa'i zhal gsum pa ste/_sngon po dang dmar po ni g.yas dang g.yon gyi zhal lo/_/
analyzed: pa'i zhal gsum pa ste/_sngon po dang dmar po ni g.yas dang g.yon gyi zhal lo/_/
translated: faces, which are smiling. The right and left faces are blue and red, respectively.

original: zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/_sku mdog dkar po la cung zad
analyzed: zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/_sku mdog dkar po la cung zad
translated: Each face has three eyes. His body is white with a slight reddish glow.

original: dmar ba'i mdangs dang ldan pa/_ral pa'i thor cog nag po la gnas pa'i
analyzed: dmar ba'i mdangs dang ldan pa/_ral pa'i thor cog nag po la gnas pa'i
translated: His black hair is piled up on the top of his head,🔽and he is adorned with a crest jewel and a variegated vajra. Below that, on the left,

original: nor bu dang sna tshhogs rdo rje/_de'i 'og du g.yon ngos su gnas pa'i zla ba'i 'od
analyzed: nor bu dang sna tshhogs rdo rje/_de'i 'og du g.yon ngos su gnas pa'i zla ba'i 'od
translated: he is seated on a moon disc.🔽The Garland of Yoginīs’ Perfected Practice, a Means of Achievement for the Entire

original: 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: Mandalas

original: dang /_sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang /_dpral ba'i steng du thod pa lnga'o/_/
analyzed: dang /_sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang /_dpral ba'i steng du thod pa lnga'o/_/
translated: He is adorned with the five buddhas’ crowns and with five skulls on his forehead.

original: gzhan yang 'khor lo dang /_rna cha dang /_mgul brgyan dang lag gdub dang ske regs dang thal ba rnams kyis brgyan pa'o/_/phyag drug pa/_rdo rje dril bus
analyzed: gzhan yang 'khor lo dang /_rna cha dang /_mgul brgyan dang lag gdub dang ske regs dang thal ba rnams kyis brgyan pa'o/_/phyag drug pa/_rdo rje dril bus
translated: He is also adorned with a wheel, earrings, a necklace, bracelets, anklets, and ashes.

original: rnam par brgyan pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/
analyzed: rnam par brgyan pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/
translated: He has six arms. His two hands that hold a vajra and bell are in the gesture of embracing his wisdom consort, who is similar to himself.

original: shes rab ma'i chu skyes la mnyam par sbyor ba'i dga' ba dang ldan pa/_phyag
analyzed: shes rab ma'i chu skyes la mnyam par sbyor ba'i dga' ba dang ldan pa/_phyag
translated: He is in union with the lotus of the wisdom consort, endowed with joy.

original: g.yas pa gnyis kyis ral gri dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis🔽thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_nyi ma'i 'od kyi rgyab yol can/_sna tshhogs
analyzed: g.yas pa gnyis kyis ral gri dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_nyi ma'i 'od kyi rgyab yol can/_sna tshhogs
translated: His two right hands hold a sword and a goad; his two left hands hold a skull cup and a noose.🔽He has a sun-ray backdrop. He is in the half-crossed-at-the-ankles dance posture on a variegated lotus, skull cup, and moon.

original: pad+ma dang thod pa dang zla ba la skyil krung phyed pas gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan🔽pas bzhugs pa'o/_/de'i thugs khar sna tshhogs pad+ma dang zla ba la ye shes sems
analyzed: pad+ma dang thod pa dang zla ba la skyil krung phyed pas gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pas bzhugs pa'o/_/de'i thugs khar sna tshhogs pad+ma dang zla ba la ye shes sems
translated: He is endowed with the nine expressions of dance.🔽In his heart, on a variegated lotus and moon, is the awareness being, white and red, in the bodhisattva cross-legged posture.

original: dpa' dkar dmar gyis mdog sems dpa'i skyil krung can/_sangs rgyas lnga'i
analyzed: dpa' dkar dmar gyis mdog sems dpa'i skyil krung can/_sangs rgyas lnga'i
translated: He has the five buddha crowns.

original: cod pan gyis spras pa/_rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_rdo rje dang dril
analyzed: cod pan gyis spras pa/_rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_rdo rje dang dril
translated: They are adorned with crowns and jeweled ornaments and hold vajras and bells.🔽

original: bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/
analyzed: bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/
translated: He is adorned with a crown and jeweled ornaments and holds a vajra and bell in his two hands, which embrace a knowledge consort similar to himself.

original: de'i thugs khar zla ba la ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' hum nag po'i gzugs so/_/🔽'dir sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can gtsho bo de'i shar phyogs su rnam
analyzed: de'i thugs khar zla ba la ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' hum nag po'i gzugs so/_/ 'dir sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can gtsho bo de'i shar phyogs su rnam
translated: At his heart, on a moon, is the concentration being, in the form of a black hūṃ.

original: par snang mdzad dkar po zhi ba/_phyag bzhi pa g.yas gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang dril bu/_g.yon pa gnyis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_lhor rin chen🔽'byung ldan dbang phyug chen po phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa gnyis kyis rin po che
analyzed: par snang mdzad dkar po zhi ba/_phyag bzhi pa g.yas gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang dril bu/_g.yon pa gnyis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_lhor rin chen 'byung ldan dbang phyug chen po phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa gnyis kyis rin po che
translated: To the east of that entire group, which has the nature of the three beings, is white Vairocana, peaceful, with four arms, the two right hands holding a wheel and a bell and the two left hands holding a skull cup and a lasso.

original: dang lcags kyu/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_nub
analyzed: dang lcags kyu/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_nub
translated: To the south is Ratnasaṃbhava, Maheśvara, with four arms, the two right hands holding a jewel and an iron hook and the two left hands holding a skull cup and a lasso.🔽To the west is Amitābha, Trilokavijaya, with four arms, the two right hands holding a lotus and a sword and the two left hands holding a skull cup and a lasso.🔽To the north is Amoghasiddhi, Amṛtakundalin, with four arms, the two right hands holding a sword and a vajra and the two left hands holding a skull cup and a lasso.

original: tu 'od dpag med dmar po phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa gnyis kyis mda' dang pad+ma'o/_/g.yon pa gnyis kyis gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_byang du don
analyzed: tu 'od dpag med dmar po phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa gnyis kyis mda' dang pad+ma'o/_/g.yon pa gnyis kyis gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_byang du don
translated: In the east is Amitābha, red, with four faces and twelve arms.

original: yod grub pa ljang khu phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa gnyis kyis rdo rje dang lcags kyu/🔽g.yon pa gnyis kyis dril bu dang /_thod pa 'dzin pa/_dbang ldan du spyan ma
analyzed: yod grub pa ljang khu phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa gnyis kyis rdo rje dang lcags kyu/ g.yon pa gnyis kyis dril bu dang /_thod pa 'dzin pa/_dbang ldan du spyan ma
translated: In the north is Amoghasiddhi, green, with four faces and twelve arms.

original: dkar mo phyag brgyad ma/_g.yas rnams kyis 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang ral gri
analyzed: dkar mo phyag brgyad ma/_g.yas rnams kyis 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang ral gri
translated: In the northeast is Locanā, white, with eight faces and sixteen arms.🔽In the southeast is Māmakī, blue, with sixteen faces and thirty-two arms.

original: dang mda' bsnams pa'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis thod pa dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang gzhu bsnams pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su ma ma ki sngon mo phyag bcu
analyzed: dang mda' bsnams pa'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis thod pa dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang gzhu bsnams pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su ma ma ki sngon mo phyag bcu
translated: In the southwest is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, yellow, with thirty-two faces and sixty-four arms.🔽In the northwest is Tārā, green, with sixty-four faces and one hundred twenty-eight arms.

original: gnyis ma/_g.yas rnams kyis mda' dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang pad+ma bsnams pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang lcags kyu dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang kha tam kha bsnams pa'o/_/srin po'i
analyzed: gnyis ma/_g.yas rnams kyis mda' dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang pad+ma bsnams pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang lcags kyu dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang kha tam kha bsnams pa'o/_/srin po'i
translated: The right hands hold an arrow, sword, vajra, chakram, jewel, and lotus; the left hands hold a bow, lasso, bell, noose, skull cup, and khaṭvāṅga.

original: mtshhams su gos dkar mo dmar mo phyag brgyad ma/_g.yas pa rnams kyis mda'
analyzed: mtshhams su gos dkar mo dmar mo phyag brgyad ma/_g.yas pa rnams kyis mda'
translated: In the southwest is red Pāṇḍaravāsinī with eight faces.

original: dang pad+ma dang ral gri dang rdo rje'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang thod pa dang zhags pa dang dril bu bsnams pa'o/_/rlung gi mtshhams su sgrol ma ljang khu phyag
analyzed: dang pad+ma dang ral gri dang rdo rje'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang thod pa dang zhags pa dang dril bu bsnams pa'o/_/rlung gi mtshhams su sgrol ma ljang khu phyag
translated: The right hands hold an arrow, lotus, sword, and vajra; the left hands hold a bow, skull cup, noose, and bell.

original: brgyad ma/_g.yas pa rnams kyis ud pal dmar po dang ral gri dang lcags kyu
analyzed: brgyad ma/_g.yas pa rnams kyis ud pal dmar po dang ral gri dang lcags kyu
translated: In the northwest is green Tārā with eight faces.🔽The right hands hold a red lotus, sword, iron hook, and arrow; the left hands hold a chakram, noose, skull cup, and bow.

original: dang mda'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis 'khor lo dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang gzhu bsnams pa'o/_/de'i phyi rol rim pa gnyis pa la shar gyi phyogs su rdo rje
analyzed: dang mda'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis 'khor lo dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang gzhu bsnams pa'o/_/de'i phyi rol rim pa gnyis pa la shar gyi phyogs su rdo rje
translated: On the second level of the surrounding wall, Vajra Vetālī is in the east.

original: drag mo dkar mo/_phyag na mda' dang lcags kyu dang /_gzhu dang byang chub kyi🔽sems kyis bkang ba'i thod pa'o/_/lho ru rdo rje sku ma ser mo/_phyag na rdo rje🔽dang mdung dang /_zhags pa dang thod pa khrag gis bskang ba'o/_/nub tu
analyzed: drag mo dkar mo/_phyag na mda' dang lcags kyu dang /_gzhu dang byang chub kyi sems kyis bkang ba'i thod pa'o/_/lho ru rdo rje sku ma ser mo/_phyag na rdo rje dang mdung dang /_zhags pa dang thod pa khrag gis bskang ba'o/_/nub tu
translated: White Caṇḍālī holds an arrow and iron hook in her two right hands and a bow and a skull cup filled with bodhicitta in her two left hands.🔽Yellow Vajra Body is in the south, holding a vajra and a spear in her two right hands and a lasso and a skull cup filled with blood in her two left hands.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje ma dmar mo/_phyag na ral gri dang rdo rje dang chus bskang ba'i🔽thod pa dang dril bu'o/_/byang du zhi ba ma ljang khu/_phyag na lde mig dang ba dan
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje ma dmar mo/_phyag na ral gri dang rdo rje dang chus bskang ba'i thod pa dang dril bu'o/_/byang du zhi ba ma ljang khu/_phyag na lde mig dang ba dan
translated: Red Vajra Passion is in the west, holding a sword, a vajra, and a skull cup filled with water in her two right hands and a chakram and a skull cup in her two left hands.

original: rtshe gsum dang rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i kha tram ka dang thod pa bsnams pa'o/_/dbang🔽ldan du rdo rje gnod sbyin ni dkar dmar gyi mdog la phyag na dbyug pa dang ud
analyzed: rtshe gsum dang rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i kha tram ka dang thod pa bsnams pa'o/_/dbang ldan du rdo rje gnod sbyin ni dkar dmar gyi mdog la phyag na dbyug pa dang ud
translated: Green Pacifier is in the north, holding a key, a banner, and a chakram marked with a vajra in her two right hands and a skull cup and a bell in her two left hands.🔽Vajrayakṣa is in the northeast, red in color, holding a club, an utpala, a skull cup, and a ḍamaru.

original: pa la dang thod pa dang da ma ru'o/_/me'i mtshhams su rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dmar

analyzed: lo la ni/_rdo rje'i gur gyi nang du sna tshhogs pad+ma dang sna tshhogs rdo rje'i lte ba la

original: gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gdugs dkar po'i 'og na gnas pa'i
analyzed: gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gdugs dkar po'i 'og na gnas pa'i
translated: In the center of the celestial palace that is located there, under a white parasol,

original: seng ge'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje 'di man cad gdan
analyzed: seng ge'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje 'di man cad gdan
translated: on top of lions, there is a multicolored lotus and sun, upon which is a vajra.🔽From here on is the seat of the heruka of the four seats.

original: bzhi'i he ru ka hum las sku mdog 'thing kha zhal gsum zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa
analyzed: bzhi'i he ru ka hum las sku mdog 'thing kha zhal gsum zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa
translated: From hūṃ, the color of the body is blue, with three faces, each with three eyes.🔽The right is white, the left is red, and the center is blue.

original: phyag drug la g.yas dkar g.yon dmar dbus 'thing /_dar gyi cod pan can/
analyzed: phyag drug la g.yas dkar g.yon dmar dbus 'thing /_dar gyi cod pan can/
translated: He has a silk crown,

original: spyi bor sna tshhogs rdo rjes mtshhan pa/_sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can/_phyag
analyzed: spyi bor sna tshhogs rdo rjes mtshhan pa/_sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can/_phyag
translated: his head is marked with a multicolored vajra cross, and he has the crown of the five buddhas.🔽His first two hands hold a vajra and a bell, embracing the mother.

original: dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams nas yum la mkhyud pa/_g.yas
analyzed: dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams nas yum la mkhyud pa/_g.yas
translated: His right

original: g.yon bar pa gnyis kyis nu ma dang bzho dong 'dzin pa/_tha ma gnyis kyis shes
analyzed: g.yon bar pa gnyis kyis nu ma dang bzho dong 'dzin pa/_tha ma gnyis kyis shes
translated: The two middle left hands hold a breast and a milk pail, and the two last left hands hold a skull cup and a trident.

original: rab mda' gzhu 'dzin pa can du 'di yan chad bsgom yab kyi 'di rnams chan yin kyus su shor ba yin
analyzed: rab mda' gzhu 'dzin pa can du 'di yan chad bsgom yab kyi 'di rnams chan yin kyus su shor ba yin
translated: The two last right hands hold a wisdom sword and a bow, and the two last left hands hold a wisdom arrow and a wisdom bow.

original: dkyil 'khor thams kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Mandala Ritual of the Glorious Supreme Original Buddha🔽Blue dakini of Timeless Awareness

original: no/_/ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo/_'di'i cod pan dar gyis bcings pa/
analyzed: no/_/ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo/_'di'i cod pan dar gyis bcings pa/
translated: Her crown is bound with silk🔽and marked with a vajra above.

original: steng du rdo rjes mtshhan pa/_sangs rgyas lnga'i 'od 'phro bas brgyan pa/_rtsha ba'i
analyzed: steng du rdo rjes mtshhan pa/_sangs rgyas lnga'i 'od 'phro bas brgyan pa/_rtsha ba'i
translated: She is adorned with the light rays of the five buddhas.🔽Her red face to the right is wrathful,🔽laughing, and smiling.

original: zhal khro ba/_gad rgyangs dang bcas pa/_g.yas pa dkar ba'i bzhad pa dang bcas pa/_g.yon dmar po sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'o/_/zhal re re la
analyzed: zhal khro ba/_gad rgyangs dang bcas pa/_g.yas pa dkar ba'i bzhad pa dang bcas pa/_g.yon dmar po sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'o/_/zhal re re la
translated: Each of her faces has three eyes.🔽In her three right hands she holds a flaying knife

original: spyan gsum gsum pa/_g.yas pa'i phyag gsum na steng du bstan pa'i kha tam ga
analyzed: spyan gsum gsum pa/_g.yas pa'i phyag gsum na steng du bstan pa'i kha tam ga
translated: facing upward,

original: dang dgra sta dang rdo rje'o/_/g.yon gyi gsum na dril bu dang khrag gis bkang ba'i
analyzed: dang dgra sta dang rdo rje'o/_/g.yon gyi gsum na dril bu dang khrag gis bkang ba'i
translated: In his three left hands he holds a bell, a skull cup filled with blood, and a khaṭvāṅga.🔽

original: thod pa dang ral gri bsnams pa'o/_/'di'i shar phyogs su rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma
analyzed: thod pa dang ral gri bsnams pa'o/_/'di'i shar phyogs su rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma
translated: In her three right hands she holds a flaying knife, a battle-ax, and a vajra. In her three left hands she holds a bell, a skull cup filled with blood, and a sword.

original: dkar mo sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'o/_/'di'i g.yon byang phyogs su 'jigs🔽byed mkha' 'gro ma gser gyi mdog can no/_/nub du ro langs ma dmar mo'o/_/🔽lho phyogs su tshan da li sngon mo'o/_/bzhi po 'di dag kyang seng ge'i steng du sna
analyzed: dkar mo sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'o/_/'di'i g.yon byang phyogs su 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ma gser gyi mdog can no/_/nub du ro langs ma dmar mo'o/_/ lho phyogs su tshan da li sngon mo'o/_/bzhi po 'di dag kyang seng ge'i steng du sna
translated: To the east of her is white Vajra dakini, who has a passionate expression.🔽To her left, in the north, is golden Bhairava dakini. To the west is red Zombie dakini, and to the south is blue Chandika.

original: tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'o/_/g.yas dang g.yon pa'i phyag gnyis kyi
analyzed: tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'o/_/g.yas dang g.yon pa'i phyag gnyis kyi
translated: All four of these dakinis stand on a multicolored lotus and sun on a lion.

original: steng du bsgreng ba'i kha tam ga dang khrag gis bskang ba'i thod pas mchod pa byed pa'o//
analyzed: steng du bsgreng ba'i kha tam ga dang khrag gis bskang ba'i thod pas mchod pa byed pa'o//
translated: With her two right and left hands she makes the threatening gesture and holds a khatvanga staff and a skull cup filled with blood.

original: dbang ldan du seng ge ma ni seng ge'i gdong can zhal dang sku'i g.yon dang g.yas
analyzed: dbang ldan du seng ge ma ni seng ge'i gdong can zhal dang sku'i g.yon dang g.yas
translated: In the northeast is Lion-faced, who has a lion face and a body that is blue on the left and red on the right.

original: kyi phyed dkar ba dang ser ba/_seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/_/me'i
analyzed: kyi phyed dkar ba dang ser ba/_seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/_/me'i
translated: The right half of her body is white and yellow, and she sits on a lion throne.

original: mtshhams su stag mo stag gdong ma zhal dang sku g.yon pa dang g.yas kyi phyed sngon po
analyzed: mtshhams su stag mo stag gdong ma zhal dang sku g.yon pa dang g.yas kyi phyed sngon po
translated: In the southeast is Tig mo stag gdong ma, with a face and body that are blue on the left and white on the right half.

original: dang dkar mo/_rin chen bdun gyi phung po la gnas pa'o/_/srin po'i
analyzed: dang dkar mo/_rin chen bdun gyi phung po la gnas pa'o/_/srin po'i
translated: She sits on a heap of the seven precious substances.

original: mtshhams su spyang khu ma spyang khu'i gdong can/_zhal dang sku g.yon dang g.yas kyi🔽phyed nag pa dang dmar po ma he la gnas pa'o/_/rlung gi mtshhams su 'ug gdong
analyzed: mtshhams su spyang khu ma spyang khu'i gdong can/_zhal dang sku g.yon dang g.yas kyi phyed nag pa dang dmar po ma he la gnas pa'o/_/rlung gi mtshhams su 'ug gdong
translated: In the southwest is Spang skum ma, with the face of a jackal. Her face and body are black on the left and red on the right half.🔽She sits on a water buffalo.🔽In the northwest is ’Ug gdong ma, with the face of an owl. Her face and body are yellow on the left and red on the right half.

original: ma 'ug pa'i gdong can zhal dang sku'i g.yon dang g.yas kyi phyed phyed ser po dang dmar po/_klu brgyad kyi mjug ma la gnas pa'o/_/bzhi po 'di dag ni g.yas
analyzed: ma 'ug pa'i gdong can zhal dang sku'i g.yon dang g.yas kyi phyed phyed ser po dang dmar po/_klu brgyad kyi mjug ma la gnas pa'o/_/bzhi po 'di dag ni g.yas
translated: She sits on the tails of eight nāgas.

original: dang g.yon pa'i phyag na rdo rje lcags kyu dang bcas pa'i rdo rje'i zhags pa'o/_/sna
analyzed: dang g.yon pa'i phyag na rdo rje lcags kyu dang bcas pa'i rdo rje'i zhags pa'o/_/sna
translated: All four have right and left hands holding a vajra goad and a vajra lasso.🔽In the northeast is Bya rgod gdong ma, with the face of a vulture. Her face and body are white on the left and black on the right half.

original: tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'o/_/de nas shar sgor rgyal po'i dbang mo
analyzed: tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'o/_/de nas shar sgor rgyal po'i dbang mo
translated: They are all standing on human corpses, and they stand in the midst of a blazing bonfire.🔽They are all adorned with the five symbolic bone ornaments and stand on variegated lotus and sun seats.

original: dkar mo phyag gnyis kyi thal mo khar bcug pa'o/_/byang du mar me can ma ser
analyzed: dkar mo phyag gnyis kyi thal mo khar bcug pa'o/_/byang du mar me can ma ser
translated: Then, at the eastern gate, white Rājādhipaṇī holds her two palms to her mouth.

original: mo mar me 'dzin pa lta bu'i thal mo spyi bor 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du 'jigs byed🔽ma dmar mo khrag gis bskang ba'i snyim pa steng du bkab nas kha'i thad kar bzung🔽nas khrag gi rgyun 'thung bar byed pa'o/_/lho ru kam pa 'dzin nag mo rdo rje'i
analyzed: mo mar me 'dzin pa lta bu'i thal mo spyi bor 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du 'jigs byed ma dmar mo khrag gis bskang ba'i snyim pa steng du bkab nas kha'i thad kar bzung nas khrag gi rgyun 'thung bar byed pa'o/_/lho ru kam pa 'dzin nag mo rdo rje'i
translated: At the northern gate, yellow Dīpaṃkarā holds her palms together at her crown, as if holding a butter lamp.🔽At the western gate, red Bhairavā holds her palms together at her mouth, covering them with blood and drinking a stream of blood.

original: snyim pa la mthe bong gnyis phan tshhun sbyar ste sdigs 'dzub gnyis kyi rtshe mo sprad nas
analyzed: snyim pa la mthe bong gnyis phan tshhun sbyar ste sdigs 'dzub gnyis kyi rtshe mo sprad nas
translated: At the southern gate, black Kaṃkālajarā holds her vajra palms together, with the two thumbs crossed and the two index fingers touching at the tips.

original: rang gi gsang ba'i gnas la bzhag nas gsang ba'i gnas ston par byed pa'o/_/
analyzed: rang gi gsang ba'i gnas la bzhag nas gsang ba'i gnas ston par byed pa'o/_/
translated: She places this at her secret place and reveals her secret place.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni sna tshhogs pad+ma dang ro'i snying khar nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa'o//
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni sna tshhogs pad+ma dang ro'i snying khar nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa'o//
translated: These four are standing on variegated lotus and sun seats in the heart of a corpse.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa'o/_/
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa'o/_/
translated: The twelve, such as Vajradaka, have one face and three eyes.

original: lha mo bcu gsum mo thams cad kyang lha'i gos dmar po bsnams pa/_dbu la
analyzed: lha mo bcu gsum mo thams cad kyang lha'i gos dmar po bsnams pa/_dbu la
translated: All thirteen goddesses hold red divine garments,🔽wear garlands of five skulls on their heads,

original: thod pa lnga'i phreng ba dang ldan pa/_phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa/_rdo rje sems
analyzed: thod pa lnga'i phreng ba dang ldan pa/_phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa/_rdo rje sems
translated: wear the five symbolic ornaments, and sit in the vajra posture.

original: dpa'i skyil dkrungs can/_klu'i rgyal po brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan pa/
analyzed: dpa'i skyil dkrungs can/_klu'i rgyal po brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan pa/
translated: They are adorned with the eight nāga kings,

original: 'jig pa'i dus kyi me'i 'od lta bu'i 'od zer gyi tshhogs kyi dra bas 'jigs par🔽byed pa/_go rims ji lta bas mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang rin🔽chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa dang /_rnam par🔽snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi me'i 'od lta bu'i 'od zer gyi tshhogs kyi dra bas 'jigs par byed pa/_go rims ji lta bas mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa dang /_rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub
translated: and they terrify with a net of blazing light rays like the fire at the end of time.🔽They are sealed by Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi,🔽and by Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: pa rnams kyis rgyas btab pa'o/_/hum hum hum hum hum/_a slo_/_u r-i e smyo a
analyzed: pa rnams kyis rgyas btab pa'o/_/hum hum hum hum hum/_a slo_/_u r-i e smyo a
translated: Hum hum hum hum hum.

original: ah 'di dag rnams ni thugs kha'i sa bon rnams so/_/om hrihswa ha zhes bya ba ni ye🔽shes mkha' 'gro ma'i snying po'i sngags so/_/om be ta li hum swa ha zhes bya ba ni las
analyzed: ah 'di dag rnams ni thugs kha'i sa bon rnams so/_/om hrihswa ha zhes bya ba ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i snying po'i sngags so/_/om be ta li hum swa ha zhes bya ba ni las
translated: A HA. These are the seed syllables of the heart.🔽Oṃ hrīḥ svāhā is the mantra of the essence of the awareness dakini.

original: thams cad pa'i ste ro langs ma'i sngags so//_//
analyzed: thams cad pa'i ste ro langs ma'i sngags so//_//
translated: Oṃ vetālī hūṃ svāhā is the mantra of the vetālī, the one who performs all activities.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Garland of Yoga Perfections, the Means of Achievement for All Maṇḍalas

original: sam bu ta'i rgyud kyi dgyes pa rdo rje lha bcu bdun pa'i dal gyi bdag nyid can la/_rdo
analyzed: sam bu ta'i rgyud kyi dgyes pa rdo rje lha bcu bdun pa'i dal gyi bdag nyid can la/_rdo
translated: In the tantra of the Heruka Sambuta, which has the nature of the maṇḍala of seventeen deities of Hevajra,

analyzed: rje gur gyi nang du chos 'byung gi dkyil na gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su
translated: inside the vajra tent, in the center of the celestial mansion located in the middle of the maṇḍala of the source of phenomena,

original: sna tshhogs pad+ma'i ze'u 'bru la gnas pa'i ro'i snying khar khrag gis bkang ba'i thod
analyzed: sna tshhogs pad+ma'i ze'u 'bru la gnas pa'i ro'i snying khar khrag gis bkang ba'i thod
translated: on the pericarp of a multicolored lotus, in the heart of a corpse, on a skull cup filled with blood,🔽on a sun, is the three-part Hevajra.

original: pa'i steng du nyi ma la dgyes pa rdo rje rnam pa gsum mo/_/bzhi pa ni ro'i gdan
analyzed: pa'i steng du nyi ma la dgyes pa rdo rje rnam pa gsum mo/_/bzhi pa ni ro'i gdan
translated: The fourth is the corpse seat.

original: med par ro/_/lo ka gsum 'gugs par byed pa ni nag po rdo rje rgya khram gyis🔽mtshhan ma dang /_dbu skra dmar po gyen du brjes la/_thod pa lnga dang phyag rgya
analyzed: med par ro/_/lo ka gsum 'gugs par byed pa ni nag po rdo rje rgya khram gyis mtshhan ma dang /_dbu skra dmar po gyen du brjes la/_thod pa lnga dang phyag rgya
translated: The one who summons the three worlds is black, marked with a vajra cross,🔽with upward-streaming red hair, adorned with five skulls, the six bone

analyzed: drug dang mi mgo'i phreng ba rlon pas brgyan pa'o/_/stag gi lpags pa'i smad
translated: ornaments, and a garland of fresh human heads,🔽wearing an apron of tiger skin, with the right foot placed on the left

original: dkris can/_g.yon pa'i brla la g.yas pa'i zhabs kyi rtshe mo bzhag pa'i dkyil
analyzed: dkris can/_g.yon pa'i brla la g.yas pa'i zhabs kyi rtshe mo bzhag pa'i dkyil
translated: thigh,

original: dkrungs phyed kyis gnas pa/_spyan gsum pa zlum pa rab tu dmar ba/_zhal🔽gcig pa/_phyag gnyis kyi g.yon pa'i phyag gis rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i thod pa khrag
analyzed: dkrungs phyed kyis gnas pa/_spyan gsum pa zlum pa rab tu dmar ba/_zhal gcig pa/_phyag gnyis kyi g.yon pa'i phyag gis rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i thod pa khrag
translated: with three eyes, round and very red, with one face,🔽with the left hand holding a skull cup marked with a vajra and filled with

original: gis bskang nas phyis 'chad pa'i bdag med ma la 'khyud pa/_phyag g.yas pa
analyzed: gis bskang nas phyis 'chad pa'i bdag med ma la 'khyud pa/_phyag g.yas pa
translated: blood, embracing the previously explained Nairātmya, with the right hand🔽raised, holding a five-pronged vajra.

original: rdo rje rtshe lnga pa 'dzin pa'i tshhul gyis bsnun pa'o/_/yang na phyag bzhi pa la'ang
analyzed: rdo rje rtshe lnga pa 'dzin pa'i tshhul gyis bsnun pa'o/_/yang na phyag bzhi pa la'ang
translated: Alternatively, there is also a four-armed version.

original: phyag gnyis pa lta bu gzhan ma'i phyag gnyis kyis bdag nyid dang mtshhungs pa'i rdo
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa lta bu gzhan ma'i phyag gnyis kyis bdag nyid dang mtshhungs pa'i rdo
translated: In the case of a two-armed form of Manjushri, for example, the two hands of the other forms of Manjushri are in the same position as those of the two-armed form.🔽

original: rje phag mo la mkhyud pa'o/_/zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro/_/yang na phyag drug
analyzed: rje phag mo la mkhyud pa'o/_/zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro/_/yang na phyag drug
translated: The difference is that in the two-armed form, the two arms of the other embrace the Vajravārāhī who is similar to oneself.

original: pa nag po zhal gsum pa nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po zhal re re la spyan🔽gsum gsum pa/_ral pa'i thor cog gis brgyan pa/_g.yas pa rnams kyis
analyzed: pa nag po zhal gsum pa nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum pa/_ral pa'i thor cog gis brgyan pa/_g.yas pa rnams kyis
translated: Alternatively, the six-armed form is black, with three faces—black, red, and white—each with three eyes.🔽It is adorned with a topknot of hair and holds a vajra, arrow, and sword with the right hands

original: rdo rje dang mda' dang rtshe gsum pa 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis rdo rje dril bu🔽dang gzhu dang thod pa'o/_/de dag gi dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu
analyzed: rdo rje dang mda' dang rtshe gsum pa 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis rdo rje dril bu dang gzhu dang thod pa'o/_/de dag gi dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu
translated: and a vajra-bell, bow, and skull cup with the left hands.

original: dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid can dang mtshhungs pa'i yum lu gu rgyud ma la mkhyud pa ste/
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid can dang mtshhungs pa'i yum lu gu rgyud ma la mkhyud pa ste/
translated: The first two hands hold a vajra and a vajra-bell and embrace the mother, the noose, who is similar to oneself.

original: gzhan yang sbyor ba ji lta bas 'di nyid kyang snga ma bzhin no/_/sngar bstan pa'i
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyor ba ji lta bas 'di nyid kyang snga ma bzhin no/_/sngar bstan pa'i
translated: The other arms are as before.🔽The three-faced form is black, red, and white, with three eyes in each face.

original: he ru ka gsum gyi shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma brgyad la g+ho ri la sogs pa'i lha mo
analyzed: he ru ka gsum gyi shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma brgyad la g+ho ri la sogs pa'i lha mo
translated: On the eight petals in the east and so forth of the three Herukas are the eight goddesses beginning with Ghorī.

original: brgyad do/_/de'i phyi rol dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshhams su gling bu ma dang pi🔽wang ma dang rdza rnga ma dang rnga rdung ma rnams so/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams la
analyzed: brgyad do/_/de'i phyi rol dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshhams su gling bu ma dang pi wang ma dang rdza rnga ma dang rnga rdung ma rnams so/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams la
translated: Outside of that, in the northeast and so forth, are the eight goddesses beginning with Veṇu.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu ma dang rdo rje zhags pa ma dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang rdo rje dril
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu ma dang rdo rje zhags pa ma dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang rdo rje dril
translated: At the gates in the east and so forth are Vajra Hook, Vajra noose, Vajra Chain, and Vajra Bell.🔽These sixteen goddesses are without method, as before.🔽The lord of the family of the three Herukas is Akṣobhya.

original: bu ma rnams so/_/lha mo bcu drug po 'di dag ni gong bzhin du thabs dang bral🔽ba'o/_/dgyes pa'i rdo rje gsum gyi rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pa'o/_/snying🔽kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/snying po'i sngags ni/_om a hum hri swa ha/_gtsho bo re
analyzed: bu ma rnams so/_/lha mo bcu drug po 'di dag ni gong bzhin du thabs dang bral ba'o/_/dgyes pa'i rdo rje gsum gyi rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pa'o/_/snying kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/snying po'i sngags ni/_om a hum hri swa ha/_gtsho bo re

analyzed: la sbyo hum hum hum phat swa ha/_om ti ma dang pa ra ta dang ki di ki di badzra hum hum hum phat swa ha/
translated: oṃ tima para ta ki di ki di vajra hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: dgyes pa rdo rje bzhi pa ni phyag bcu drug pa mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa/_bdag🔽med ma la mkhyud pa/_'dir khyad par du bdud bzhi ni gong du bshad pa'i ro'i
analyzed: dgyes pa rdo rje bzhi pa ni phyag bcu drug pa mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa/_bdag med ma la mkhyud pa/_'dir khyad par du bdud bzhi ni gong du bshad pa'i ro'i
translated: The four-faced Hevajra is sealed with Akṣobhya,🔽embracing Nairātmya.

original: gnas su phung po'i bdud ni tshhangs pa'i gzugs ser po/_nyon mongs pa'i
analyzed: gnas su phung po'i bdud ni tshhangs pa'i gzugs ser po/_nyon mongs pa'i
translated: Here, the four māras are the māra of the skandhas, the white Brahmā, in the place of the corpse explained above;

analyzed: bdud khyab 'jug nag po/_'chi bdag gi bdud dbang phyug chen po dkar po/
translated: the māra of afflictions, black Viṣṇu; the māra of the Lord of Death, white Maheśvara;🔽and the māra of the devaputras, yellow Indra.

analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud lha'i dbang po ser po/_de dag gi steng du bcom ldan 'das

original: zhabs gnyis kyis rdo rje'i skyil krung phyed pas gnas pa dang /_gzhan gnyis ni
analyzed: zhabs gnyis kyis rdo rje'i skyil krung phyed pas gnas pa dang /_gzhan gnyis ni
translated: is seated in half-vajra posture with both feet. The other two feet are🔽the left foot drawn in and the right extended.

original: g.yon bskum pa dang g.yas bskyang bas bzhugs pa'i zhabs bzhi pa/_sku mdog
analyzed: g.yon bskum pa dang g.yas bskyang bas bzhugs pa'i zhabs bzhi pa/_sku mdog
translated: He has four feet and is🔽blue-black in color.

original: nag po dang sna tshhogs rdo rje la sogs pa nas stag gi lpags pa'i bar du sngar
analyzed: nag po dang sna tshhogs rdo rje la sogs pa nas stag gi lpags pa'i bar du sngar
translated: From the black and variegated vajras and so forth up to the tiger skin, the special features are as explained previously.

original: bshad pa'i khyad par can/_zhal brgyad pa spyan nyi shu rtsha bzhi pa'o/_/rtsha ba'i
analyzed: bshad pa'i khyad par can/_zhal brgyad pa spyan nyi shu rtsha bzhi pa'o/_/rtsha ba'i
translated: He has eight faces and twenty-four eyes.

original: zhal nag po gad mo rgod pa/_g.yas pa dkar po 'dzum pa g.yon pa dmar po/
analyzed: zhal nag po gad mo rgod pa/_g.yas pa dkar po 'dzum pa g.yon pa dmar po/
translated: The lower face is black and laughing, the right face is white and smiling, and the left face is red.

original: steng gi mche ba rtshigs pa/_gzhan rnams ni nag po'o/_/g.yas pa'i phyag
analyzed: steng gi mche ba rtshigs pa/_gzhan rnams ni nag po'o/_/g.yas pa'i phyag
translated: The upper fangs are bared, and the others are black.

original: rnams na rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' dang 'khor lo dang chang gi snod dang dbyug
analyzed: rnams na rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' dang 'khor lo dang chang gi snod dang dbyug
translated: In his right hands he holds a vajra, sword, arrow, chakram, liquor-filled skull cup, club,🔽triple-tipped khaṭvāṅga, and iron hook.

original: pa dang rtshe gsum dang lcags kyu rnams so/_/g.yon pa rnams su dril bu dang pad+ma
analyzed: pa dang rtshe gsum dang lcags kyu rnams so/_/g.yon pa rnams su dril bu dang pad+ma
translated: In his left hands he holds a bell, lotus,

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

original: dang gzhu dang kha tam ka bsgreng ba dang thod pa dang rin po che dang sdigs 'dzub
analyzed: dang gzhu dang kha tam ka bsgreng ba dang thod pa dang rin po che dang sdigs 'dzub

original: dang bcas pa'i zhags pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab ma la g+ho ri dkar mo phyag g.yas pa
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i zhags pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab ma la g+ho ri dkar mo phyag g.yas pa
translated: and a noose.🔽On the petal in the east, white Gaurī holds a flaying knife in her right hand and a rohita fish in her left hand.🔽

original: gnyis na mda' bkang ba dang rdo rje dril bu/_g.yon pa gnyis na khrag gis
analyzed: gnyis na mda' bkang ba dang rdo rje dril bu/_g.yon pa gnyis na khrag gis
translated: On the petal in the east is white Ghorī, holding a bow and arrow and a vajra and bell in her two right hands

original: bkang ba'i thod pa dang gzhu dang nya ro hi ta dang bcas pa'o/_/lho phyogs su
analyzed: bkang ba'i thod pa dang gzhu dang nya ro hi ta dang bcas pa'o/_/lho phyogs su
translated: and a skull cup filled with blood and a bow and a rohita fish in her two left hands.

original: tsho'u ri ma dmar mo rdo rje dang da ma ru dang thod pa khrag gis bkang ba'i phag pa🔽dang bcas pa'o/_/nub du ro langs ma dkar ser ral gri dang rus sbal dang bcas pa'i khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa dang /_chang gis bkang ba'i thod pa
analyzed: tsho'u ri ma dmar mo rdo rje dang da ma ru dang thod pa khrag gis bkang ba'i phag pa dang bcas pa'o/_/nub du ro langs ma dkar ser ral gri dang rus sbal dang bcas pa'i khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa dang /_chang gis bkang ba'i thod pa
translated: In the south is red Caurī, holding a vajra and a ḍamaru and a skull cup filled with blood and a pig🔽with a skull cup filled with blood.🔽In the west is yellow-white Vetālī, holding a sword and a skull cup filled with blood and a tortoise🔽and a skull cup filled with beer and a skull cup filled with urine.

original: dang dri chus bkang ba'i thod pa'o/_/byang du g+hasma ri ljang khu cung zad ser ba
analyzed: dang dri chus bkang ba'i thod pa'o/_/byang du g+hasma ri ljang khu cung zad ser ba
translated: In the north is green Ghasmarī, slightly yellow, holding a skull cup filled with bone marrow and a snake

original: rkang mar gyis gang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i sbrul dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya
analyzed: rkang mar gyis gang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i sbrul dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya

original: dang /_rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i me thab dang dgra sta'o/_/dbang ldan du pu ka si🔽ser mo shas gang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i seng ge dang mchod sbyin gyi phyag rgya
analyzed: dang /_rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i me thab dang dgra sta'o/_/dbang ldan du pu ka si ser mo shas gang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i seng ge dang mchod sbyin gyi phyag rgya
translated: In the northeast is Pukkasī,

original: dang /_dpag bsam gyi shing gi yal ga dang rin po che'o/_/me'i mtshhams🔽su sha ba ri dkar mo byang chub sems kyis gang ba'i thod par dge slong dang rdo
analyzed: dang /_dpag bsam gyi shing gi yal ga dang rin po che'o/_/me'i mtshhams su sha ba ri dkar mo byang chub sems kyis gang ba'i thod par dge slong dang rdo
translated: yellow, standing on a lion in a skull cup filled with flesh, with the mudrā of generosity and a branch of the wish-fulfilling tree and a jewel.🔽In the southeast is Śavarī,

original: rje dang /_kha tam ka dang zhags pa'o/_/srin po'i mtshhams su tshan d+ha li sngon
analyzed: rje dang /_kha tam ka dang zhags pa'o/_/srin po'i mtshhams su tshan d+ha li sngon
translated: white, standing on a skull cup filled with bodhicitta, holding a monk and a vajra in her first pair of hands and a khaṭvāṅga and a noose in the other two.🔽In the southwest is Caṇḍālī,🔽blue, holding a skull cup filled with blood in her right hand and a tiger and a pūgapuṣpa in her left, with the other two hands holding the fluttering garment.

original: mo g.yas su khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa la stag dang g.yon du pu ka ri ka dang / phyag gzhan gnyis na rlung bskyod kyi gos so/_/rlung mtshhams su do bi ni nag mo
analyzed: mo g.yas su khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa la stag dang g.yon du pu ka ri ka dang / phyag gzhan gnyis na rlung bskyod kyi gos so/_/rlung mtshhams su do bi ni nag mo
translated: In the northwest is Ḍombinī,

original: chang gi snod thod pa dang rtshe gsum pa gyen du bstan pa dang /_bdud rtshi lngas
analyzed: chang gi snod thod pa dang rtshe gsum pa gyen du bstan pa dang /_bdud rtshi lngas
translated: black, holding a skull cup filled with liquor and a trident facing upward and the five meats and five elixirs.

original: gang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i spyang gi dang thong bshol lo/_/de dag rnams kyi
analyzed: gang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i spyang gi dang thong bshol lo/_/de dag rnams kyi
translated: The skull cup filled with blood is held in the right hand, and the flaying knife and skull cup are held in the left hand.

original: phyi'i zur du gling bu ma la sogs pa bzhi gong bzhin du'o/_/shar gyi sgo ru stag🔽gdong ma nag mo zhal rnams nag pa dang dkar ba dang dmar po dang ser po dang steng du stag gdong ljang khu'o/_/lhor phag gdong ma ser mo dang nag mo dang /
analyzed: phyi'i zur du gling bu ma la sogs pa bzhi gong bzhin du'o/_/shar gyi sgo ru stag gdong ma nag mo zhal rnams nag pa dang dkar ba dang dmar po dang ser po dang steng du stag gdong ljang khu'o/_/lhor phag gdong ma ser mo dang nag mo dang /
translated: The four goddesses such as Ghaṇṭāpāṇi are in the outer corners as before.🔽At the eastern gate is Siṃhamukha, black, with black, white, red, and yellow faces and a green lion face above.

original: dkar mo rnams kyi zhal dang /_steng du phag pa'i zhal dmar po'o/_/nub du🔽khyi gdong ma dmar mo/_dmar mo dang nag po dang dkar po'i zhal rnams dang steng du khyi gdong ser po'o/_/byang du seng gdong ma ljang khu rnams ni ljang khu
analyzed: dkar mo rnams kyi zhal dang /_steng du phag pa'i zhal dmar po'o/_/nub du khyi gdong ma dmar mo/_dmar mo dang nag po dang dkar po'i zhal rnams dang steng du khyi gdong ser po'o/_/byang du seng gdong ma ljang khu rnams ni ljang khu
translated: At the southern gate is Vārāhī, yellow, with yellow, black, and white faces and a red pig face above.🔽At the western gate is Śvānamukhā, red, with red, black, and white faces and a yellow dog face above.

original: dang nag po dang dkar mo rnam dang steng du seng ge'i gdong pa can dmar po'o/_/
analyzed: dang nag po dang dkar mo rnam dang steng du seng ge'i gdong pa can dmar po'o/_/
translated: At the northern gate is Gṛdhrāmukhi, green, with green, black, and white faces and a red vulture face above.

original: de lta bas na rtsha ba dang g.yas dang g.yon dang steng gi rim pas zhal bzhi pa'o/_/
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsha ba dang g.yas dang g.yon dang steng gi rim pas zhal bzhi pa'o/_/
translated: Therefore, the four faces are in the order of east, south, west, and north.

original: sgo skyong ma rnams phyag bzhi pa rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhin du phyag mtshhan🔽'dzin pa/_sna tshhogs pad+ma dang khrag gis bskang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i
analyzed: sgo skyong ma rnams phyag bzhi pa rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhin du phyag mtshhan 'dzin pa/_sna tshhogs pad+ma dang khrag gis bskang ba'i thod pa la gnas pa'i
translated: The gate protectors have four arms, holding their respective implements, such as a vajra hook, and so on.🔽They stand on corpses in the posture with the right leg bent and the left extended, upon variegated lotuses and skull cups filled with blood.

original: ro'i steng du g.yas bskum pa dang g.yon bskyang bas gnas pa/_dbu skra dmar
analyzed: ro'i steng du g.yas bskum pa dang g.yon bskyang bas gnas pa/_dbu skra dmar
translated: Their red hair bristles upward.

original: po gyen du brdzes pa'o/_/lha gzhan rnams ni rdo rje'i dkyil dkrung phyed pa/
analyzed: po gyen du brdzes pa'o/_/lha gzhan rnams ni rdo rje'i dkyil dkrung phyed pa/
translated: The other deities have half-vajra postures.

original: thams cad kyang zhal re re zhing spyan gsum pa/_phyag rgya lnga la sogs pas
analyzed: thams cad kyang zhal re re zhing spyan gsum pa/_phyag rgya lnga la sogs pas
translated: All of them have three eyes in each face and are adorned with the five symbolic ornaments and so on.

original: brgyan pa yab med pa'o/_/bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi sa bon hum ngo /_/
analyzed: brgyan pa yab med pa'o/_/bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi sa bon hum ngo /_/
translated: They are without consorts. The Bhagavat’s heart seed syllable is hūṃ.

original: snying po'i sngags ni/_om de ba pi tshu badzra hum hum hum phat phat phat swa ha zhes so/_/
analyzed: snying po'i sngags ni/_om de ba pi tshu badzra hum hum hum phat phat phat swa ha zhes so/_/
translated: The essence mantra is oṃ devapicu vajra hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: om a+o swa ha zhes pa ni g+hasma ri'i las thams cad pa'i sngags so/_/dgyes pa rdo🔽rje rnam pa bzhi'o//_//🔽lha dgu'i bdag med ma'i dal la rdo rje gur gyi nang du chos 'byung la gnas
analyzed: om a+o swa ha zhes pa ni g+hasma ri'i las thams cad pa'i sngags so/_/dgyes pa rdo rje rnam pa bzhi'o//_// lha dgu'i bdag med ma'i dal la rdo rje gur gyi nang du chos 'byung la gnas
translated: Om om svaha is the mantra of all activities of Ghasmari.

original: pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar bdag med ma'o/_/🔽shar la sogs pa'i 'dab mar rdo rje ma dang g+ho'u ri ma dang tsho'u ri ma dang g+hasma🔽ri dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams so/_/rim pa gnyis par sna tshhogs pad+ma la/
analyzed: pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar bdag med ma'o/_/ shar la sogs pa'i 'dab mar rdo rje ma dang g+ho'u ri ma dang tsho'u ri ma dang g+hasma ri dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams so/_/rim pa gnyis par sna tshhogs pad+ma la/
translated: The mandala of Nairatmya with nine deities. In the vajra tent, in the center of the celestial palace situated in the source of phenomena, is Nairatmya in the center of a multicolored lotus.🔽On the petals in the east and so forth are Vajra Woman, Ghoridari, Chatri, Ghasmari and Vajra Dakini.

original: shar la sogs par g+ho ri dang tsho'u ri dang b+he ta li dang g+hasma ri rnams so/_/
analyzed: shar la sogs par g+ho ri dang tsho'u ri dang b+he ta li dang g+hasma ri rnams so/_/
translated: On the second level, on a multicolored lotus in the east and so forth are Ghoridari, Chatri, Bhetaki and Ghasmari.

original: dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshhams rnams su pu ka si dang sa ba ri dang tshan da li
analyzed: dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshhams rnams su pu ka si dang sa ba ri dang tshan da li
translated: In the northeast and so forth are Pukkasi, Savari, Chandali and Tamdrinma.

original: dang thams bi ma rnams so/_/bdag med ma'i steng gi shar phyogs su pad+ma la gnas
analyzed: dang thams bi ma rnams so/_/bdag med ma'i steng gi shar phyogs su pad+ma la gnas
translated: In the east above Nairatmya is a lotus with a sun and a moon.

original: pa'i mkha' spyod ma zhal gyen du gzigs pa'o/_/'og gi nub phyogs su pad+ma la
analyzed: pa'i mkha' spyod ma zhal gyen du gzigs pa'o/_/'og gi nub phyogs su pad+ma la
translated: In the southwest is the space-faring goddess with her face turned upward.

original: gnas pa'i sa spyod ma zhal thur du gzigs pa'o/_/phyi'i rim pa la gnas pa'i
analyzed: gnas pa'i sa spyod ma zhal thur du gzigs pa'o/_/phyi'i rim pa la gnas pa'i
translated: In the northwest is the earth-faring goddess with her face turned downward.

original: g+ho ri la sogs pa brgyad ni phyag bcu drug pa'i dal lta bu ser po la sogs pa'i
analyzed: g+ho ri la sogs pa brgyad ni phyag bcu drug pa'i dal lta bu ser po la sogs pa'i
translated: The eight goddesses in the outer ring, such as Ghorī, are yellow, like the mandala of the sixteen-armed form.

original: mdog can no/_/gzhan bdun ni sngon mo'o/_/'di dag bco lnga po thams
analyzed: mdog can no/_/gzhan bdun ni sngon mo'o/_/'di dag bco lnga po thams

analyzed: cad dkyil dkrung phyed kyis ro'i snying khar gnas pa'i nyi ma'i dal la bzhugs pa/
translated: All fifteen of these goddesses are in half-lotus posture, standing on a sun mandala in the heart of a corpse.

original: zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa/_dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa/_stag gi🔽lpags pa bsnams pa/_phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas gnyis kyis rdo rje dang gri gug_/
analyzed: zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa/_dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa/_stag gi lpags pa bsnams pa/_phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas gnyis kyis rdo rje dang gri gug_/
translated: They have one face, three eyes, and orange hair bristling upward. They hold tiger-skin skirts,

original: g.yon gnyis kyis thod pa dang gyen du bsgreng ba'i kha tam ga 'dzin pa'o/_/mgo la
analyzed: g.yon gnyis kyis thod pa dang gyen du bsgreng ba'i kha tam ga 'dzin pa'o/_/mgo la
translated: have four arms, and hold a vajra and flaying knife in the two right hands and a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga in the two left hands.

original: mi mgo lnga'i phreng ba can/_phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa'o/_/zur rnams la gling bu
analyzed: mi mgo lnga'i phreng ba can/_phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa'o/_/zur rnams la gling bu
translated: They have garlands of five human heads and the five symbolic ornaments.🔽In the corners are the four goddesses of the doors.

analyzed: ma la sogs pa bzhi ni sngar bzhin no/_/shar gyi sgor stag gdong ma dkar sngo/
translated: The four beginning with Mā are as before.🔽At the eastern gate is white Vārahī,

analyzed: lho ru phag gdong ser sngon/_nub du khyi gdong ma dmar ljang /_byang du seng
translated: at the southern gate is yellow Vārāhī,🔽at the western gate is red Śvāna-mukha,🔽and at the northern gate is blue-green Siṃha-mukha.

analyzed: ba'i 'khor lo rtshibs bcu pa yang yod do/_/gzhal yas khang gi dbus su snam

translated: holds a tortoise in her right hand and a lotus in her left. The green Ghasmarī🔽holds a snake in her right hand and a skull cup in her left. The blue Pukkasī🔽holds a lion in her right hand and an axe in her left. The white Śavarī

translated: The lords of the families of the four beginning with Ghorī are Akṣobhya,🔽Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, and Amitābha.🔽They are the seals of those.

analyzed: yang na dal gyi rtsho bo sngon po phyag bzhi pa/_phyag g.yas pas rdo rje 'dzin pa/

analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas gar byed pa/_smin ma g.yo ba dang bcas pa'i khro gnyer can/

analyzed: mche ba brtshigs pa rnams so/_/mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa dang sna tshhogs rdo rjes

analyzed: mtshhan pa dang /_dbu skra dmar po gyen du brdzes pa dang /_mi mgo lngas dbu

analyzed: brgyan pa'o/_/phyag bcu drug pa ltar 'khor lo la sogs pas brgyan pa'o/_/de dag

analyzed: kyang g+ho ri la sogs pa lha mo rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba ste/_lha mo 'di

analyzed: om de ba pi tshu badzra hu~m hu~mhum hu~m phat swa ha/_phyag bcu drug pa'i snying po'o/_/om tam lokya

analyzed: k+she pa hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes pa ni phyag gnyis pa'i'o/_/om dz+wa la dz+wa la sbyo hum

analyzed: hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/_phyag bzhi pa'i 'o/_/o ki ti ki ti badzra hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/

analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

analyzed: phyag drug pa'i'o/_/om a badzra g+hasma ri om hum swa ha zhes bya ba ni las thams cad

analyzed: pa'i de las thams cad pa yin pa'i rgyu mtshhan ni byang phyogs kyi lha mo don grub yin pas gsung sngags so//_//

original: dpal sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i dal du rdo rje gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i chos🔽'byung gi nang du gzhal yas khang ngo /_/kha gcig gi lugs kyis rdo rje gur gyi

translated: In the maṇḍala of the Great Magical Web of Illusion, the celestial palace is inside the source of phenomena that is located within the vajra tent.🔽According to another system, the celestial palace is inside the vajra tent without the source of phenomena.

original: nang du chos 'byung med par gzhal yas khang ngo /_/gzhal yas khang gi dbus su🔽pad+ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'bru la nyi ma'i gdan la sgyu 'phrul chen
analyzed: nang du chos 'byung med par gzhal yas khang ngo /_/gzhal yas khang gi dbus su pad+ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'bru la nyi ma'i gdan la sgyu 'phrul chen
translated: In the center of the celestial palace,🔽on the pericarp of an eight-petaled red lotus, on a sun seat, is the Great Magical Web of Illusion, a black heruka.

original: mo'i ming can he ru ka nag po/_nyi ma lta bu'i 'bar ba'i phreng ba du ma 'khrigs
analyzed: mo'i ming can he ru ka nag po/_nyi ma lta bu'i 'bar ba'i phreng ba du ma 'khrigs

original: pa/_sgeg pa'i khro bo dbu skra 'bar zhing gyen du brdzes pa/_thod pas brgyan🔽pa'i cod pan can/_sngon po dang ser po dang dkar po dang ljang khu'i rtsha ba'i
analyzed: pa/_sgeg pa'i khro bo dbu skra 'bar zhing gyen du brdzes pa/_thod pas brgyan pa'i cod pan can/_sngon po dang ser po dang dkar po dang ljang khu'i rtsha ba'i
translated: He is a wrathful one with a crown of hair blazing upward and adorned with a head ornament of skulls.

original: zhal dang g.yas dang nub dang g.yon gyi zhal dang bzhi'o/_/zhal re re la'ang
analyzed: zhal dang g.yas dang nub dang g.yon gyi zhal dang bzhi'o/_/zhal re re la'ang
