analyzed: 'dzin pa'o/_/rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ni glang po che la sogs pa'i steng na pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i glang po che'i lpags pa'i smad g.yogs dang mi'i lpags pa stod du gyon pa'o/_/dbang ldan du seng ge la rol pa'i tshhul du gnas
translated: Vajra dakini, and so on, stand on an elephant, and so on, upon a lotus and sun.🔽They wear an elephant-skin skirt and human skin draped over their upper body.🔽In the northeast, on a seat of a lion in the midst of copulation, is white Lioness.

original: pa'i seng ge ma dkar ser/_phyag gnyis pa'i g.yas steng du phyar bas kha tam ga
analyzed: pa'i seng ge ma dkar ser/_phyag gnyis pa'i g.yas steng du phyar bas kha tam ga
translated: She has two arms, and with the right one she holds a khaṭvāṅga aloft.

original: 'dzin pa/_g.yon pas sdigs 'dzub dang bcas pa'i thod pa 'dzin pas🔽bzhugs pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su gnod sbyin rdo rje gdong gi gdan la zlum po'i
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_g.yon pas sdigs 'dzub dang bcas pa'i thod pa 'dzin pas bzhugs pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su gnod sbyin rdo rje gdong gi gdan la zlum po'i
translated: and holds a skull cup with his left hand in a threatening gesture.🔽In the southeast, on a Yakṣa Vajramukha seat, is a white tigress

original: tshhul gyis gnas pa'i stag mo dkar mo/_phyag gnyis ma/_g.yas dang g.yon🔽pa lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/srin po'i mtshhams su ma he la dkyil
analyzed: tshhul gyis gnas pa'i stag mo dkar mo/_phyag gnyis ma/_g.yas dang g.yon pa lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/srin po'i mtshhams su ma he la dkyil
translated: standing with her body curved in a circle, with two hands holding a hook in the right and a noose in the left.🔽In the southwest, on a buffalo, is a red-black jackal-faced bitch🔽sitting in half-lotus posture, with two hands holding an ax and a noose.

original: dkrung phyed kyis bzhugs pa'i spyang mo spyang khu'i zhal ma dmar nag phyag gnyis pa🔽dgra sta dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/rlung gi mtshhams su 'ug pa'i gdong can ma
analyzed: dkrung phyed kyis bzhugs pa'i spyang mo spyang khu'i zhal ma dmar nag phyag gnyis pa dgra sta dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/rlung gi mtshhams su 'ug pa'i gdong can ma
translated: In the northwest, on a seat of a corpse, is a red-yellow owl-faced bitch

original: 'ug pa ma tshog pur gnas dmar ser phyag gnyis pa dbyug pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: 'ug pa ma tshog pur gnas dmar ser phyag gnyis pa dbyug pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: standing with her body curved in a circle, with two hands holding a club and a noose.

original: 'di rnams ni rang rang gi chibs la pad+ma dang nyi ma'i steng na gnas pa'o/_/shar
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rang rang gi chibs la pad+ma dang nyi ma'i steng na gnas pa'o/_/shar
translated: All of them stand on lotus-sun seats on their respective mounts.

original: du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i rgyab du mkha' 'gro ma dkar mo phyag gnyis kyi rtshe mo khar🔽bcug pa'o/_/byang du sdigs byed mkha' 'gro ma'i rgyab du mar me ma ser mo spyi
analyzed: du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i rgyab du mkha' 'gro ma dkar mo phyag gnyis kyi rtshe mo khar bcug pa'o/_/byang du sdigs byed mkha' 'gro ma'i rgyab du mar me ma ser mo spyi
translated: Behind Vajra dakini in the east is white dakini, her two hands holding a skull cup to her mouth.

original: bor thal mo sbyar ba dang bcas pa'i mar me 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du ro langs ma'i
analyzed: bor thal mo sbyar ba dang bcas pa'i mar me 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du ro langs ma'i
translated: Behind Threatening dakini in the north is yellow Lamp dakini, holding a lamp to her head with her palms joined.

original: rgyab du 'dzin ma dmar mo snyim pa khrag gis bskang ba khar bcug pa'o/_/lhor
analyzed: rgyab du 'dzin ma dmar mo snyim pa khrag gis bskang ba khar bcug pa'o/_/lhor
translated: Behind Zombie dakini in the west is red Grabbing dakini, holding a skull cup filled with blood to her mouth.

original: gtum mo'i rgyab du kam po dzi nag mo phyag gnyis kyis thugs khar gtun shing 'phyar
analyzed: gtum mo'i rgyab du kam po dzi nag mo phyag gnyis kyis thugs khar gtun shing 'phyar
translated: Behind Fierce dakini in the south is black Khandaroha, her two hands holding a pestle at her heart.

original: ba'o/_/bzhi po 'di dag pad+ma dang nyi ma dang ro'i gdan la gnas pa'o/_/de
analyzed: ba'o/_/bzhi po 'di dag pad+ma dang nyi ma dang ro'i gdan la gnas pa'o/_/de
translated: These four are on lotus, sun, and corpse seats.

original: nas rdo rje phreng ba 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i phyi rol gyi rim pa la bskor ba la pad+ma dang zla ba rnams la/_shar phyogs su pu ka si dang dra bi li dang /_gtum mo rnams
analyzed: nas rdo rje phreng ba 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i phyi rol gyi rim pa la bskor ba la pad+ma dang zla ba rnams la/_shar phyogs su pu ka si dang dra bi li dang /_gtum mo rnams
translated: Then, on the outer rim of the garland of light of the vajra fence, on lotuses and moons in the east are Pukkasi and Shaundini,

original: phyag gnyis ma bdud rtshi'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du 'jigs byed ma dang / khrag mdog mo dang /_sa ga ma rnams me lngas gang ba'i pad+ma'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: phyag gnyis ma bdud rtshi'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du 'jigs byed ma dang / khrag mdog mo dang /_sa ga ma rnams me lngas gang ba'i pad+ma'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: In the north are Bhairava, Raktavarṇa, and Bhagini, holding lotus bowls filled with the five fires.

original: nub du drag shul ma dang /_'bar ba ma dang /_mi sdug pa'i gzugs can ma
analyzed: nub du drag shul ma dang /_'bar ba ma dang /_mi sdug pa'i gzugs can ma
translated: In the west are Caṇḍālī, Jvalamālā, and Durvarṇā, holding bowls of bali offerings.

original: dkyil 'khor thams kyi kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba🔽rnams gtor ma'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor thod pa ma dang /_rdo rje ma dang / bum pa ma rnams btung ba'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/dbang ldan du sgeg mo/_sgeg
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams kyi kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba rnams gtor ma'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor thod pa ma dang /_rdo rje ma dang / bum pa ma rnams btung ba'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/dbang ldan du sgeg mo/_sgeg
translated: The Garland of Yoginīs’ Perfected Yoga, a Sādhana for the Entire Maṇḍala🔽In the south are Kapālinī, Vajrī, and Kumbhī, holding drinking bowls.

original: pa'i tshhul gyis gar byed pa dang /_dri ma dri'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/me
analyzed: pa'i tshhul gyis gar byed pa dang /_dri ma dri'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/me
translated: In the northeast is Lāsya, dancing with a flirtatious expression, and Gandhā, holding a perfume container.

original: mtshhams su pi wang ma pi wang bsgreng ba dang /_me tog ma me tog gi phreng ba steng
analyzed: mtshhams su pi wang ma pi wang bsgreng ba dang /_me tog ma me tog gi phreng ba steng
translated: In the southeast is Vīṇā, holding a vertical vīṇā, and Puṣpā, holding a flower garland.

original: du 'thor ba'o/_/srin po'i mtshhams su glu ma kha'i thad khar sdigs 'dzub g.yo ba
analyzed: du 'thor ba'o/_/srin po'i mtshhams su glu ma kha'i thad khar sdigs 'dzub g.yo ba
translated: and the ashes are scattered.🔽In the mouth of the rakshasa, the index finger moves in the direction of the throat.🔽

original: dang /_bdug spos ma bdug spos dang bcas pa'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: dang /_bdug spos ma bdug spos dang bcas pa'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: In the southeast, the red Rakshasi holds a skull cup filled with human flesh and blood in her two hands.🔽In the southwest, the black Vetali holds a human corpse in her two hands.🔽In the northwest, the white Ghasmari holds a skull cup filled with blood in her two hands.

original: rlung gi mtshhams su gar ma dkar mo gar gyi tshhul gyis steng du thal mo sbyar ba dang / mar me ma mar me'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa
analyzed: rlung gi mtshhams su gar ma dkar mo gar gyi tshhul gyis steng du thal mo sbyar ba dang / mar me ma mar me'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa
translated: In the northeast, the red Pukkasl holds a human heart in her two hands.

original: sum cu rtsha gsum po 'di dag thams cad kyang zhal gcig pa/_phyag gnyis pa/
analyzed: sum cu rtsha gsum po 'di dag thams cad kyang zhal gcig pa/_phyag gnyis pa/
translated: All thirty-three of these dakinis have one face, two arms,

original: spyan gsum pa/_dbu skra grol ba/_dbu la mi mgo lnga'i phreng ba can no/_/
analyzed: spyan gsum pa/_dbu skra grol ba/_dbu la mi mgo lnga'i phreng ba can no/_/
translated: three eyes, and loose hair. They all have a garland of five human heads.

original: khyad par du 'jigs byed kyi mkha' 'gro ma ni dbu skra gyen du brdzes pa/_seng ge
analyzed: khyad par du 'jigs byed kyi mkha' 'gro ma ni dbu skra gyen du brdzes pa/_seng ge
translated: In particular, the dakini of Bhairava has hair standing upward,🔽and Simhi and the others wear red garments.

original: mo la sogs pa gos dmar po gyon pa/_pu ka si la sogs pa rnams ni dkar mo
analyzed: mo la sogs pa gos dmar po gyon pa/_pu ka si la sogs pa rnams ni dkar mo
translated: Pukkasl and the others are white,

original: ste/_me'i mtshhams kyi lha mo rnams kyang de bzhin no/_/'jigs byed kyi
analyzed: ste/_me'i mtshhams kyi lha mo rnams kyang de bzhin no/_/'jigs byed kyi
translated: and the goddesses of the fire quadrant are also white.

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ni ser mo ste/_dbang ldan gyi lha mo gnyis kyang de🔽bzhin no/_/drag shul ma la sogs pa rnams ni dmar mo ste/_rlung gi mtshhams
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ni ser mo ste/_dbang ldan gyi lha mo gnyis kyang de bzhin no/_/drag shul ma la sogs pa rnams ni dmar mo ste/_rlung gi mtshhams
translated: The dakinis and so forth are yellow, as are the two goddesses of Ishana.🔽The fierce ones and so forth are red, as are the goddesses of the wind.

original: kyi lha mo rnams kyang de bzhin no/_/thod pa ma la sogs pa rnams ni nag mo ste/🔽srin po'i mtshhams kyi lha mo rnams kyang de bzhin no/_/de nas rdo rje phreng ba'i
analyzed: kyi lha mo rnams kyang de bzhin no/_/thod pa ma la sogs pa rnams ni nag mo ste/ srin po'i mtshhams kyi lha mo rnams kyang de bzhin no/_/de nas rdo rje phreng ba'i
translated: The skull-garlanded goddesses and so forth are black, as are the rakshasa goddesses.

original: phyi'i rim pa'i sgo rnams dang snam bu'i mtshhams la mtshho skyes dang zla ba'i gdan
analyzed: phyi'i rim pa'i sgo rnams dang snam bu'i mtshhams la mtshho skyes dang zla ba'i gdan
translated: Then, on the outer rim, at the doors and in the corners of the platforms,🔽are the seats of the sun and moon.

original: rnams la ni/_shar sgor khyab 'jug nag po dang /_byang du tshhangs pa ser po
analyzed: rnams la ni/_shar sgor khyab 'jug nag po dang /_byang du tshhangs pa ser po
translated: At the eastern door is black Vishnu, at the northern door is yellow Brahma,

original: dang /_nub du dbang phyug chen po dkar po dang /_lho ru gdong drug dmar
analyzed: dang /_nub du dbang phyug chen po dkar po dang /_lho ru gdong drug dmar
translated: at the western door is white Mahesvara, and at the southern door is red Skanda.

original: po dang /_dbang ldan gyi mtshhams su dbang po ser po dang /_me'i mtshhams su
analyzed: po dang /_dbang ldan gyi mtshhams su dbang po ser po dang /_me'i mtshhams su
translated: At the corner of Ishana is yellow Indra, at the corner of Agni is red🔽Yama, at the corner of Nirriti is black Varuna, and at the corner of🔽Vayu is green Kubera.

original: lus ngan po ser po dang /_srin po'i mtshhams su gshin rje nag po dang / rlung gi mtshhams su chu lha dkar po'o/_/shar gyi snam bu la shar du ka ka ra'i
analyzed: lus ngan po ser po dang /_srin po'i mtshhams su gshin rje nag po dang / rlung gi mtshhams su chu lha dkar po'o/_/shar gyi snam bu la shar du ka ka ra'i
translated: In the southeast is yellow Pūtanā, in the southwest is black Yama, and in the northwest is white Varuṇa.🔽On the eastern petal, Kakarbūra is in the east, white and holding a skull and a khaṭvāṅga.🔽In the north is yellow Caṇḍa, in the south is red Mahābala, and in the west is black Mahābhairava.🔽On the southern petal, Caṇḍa is in the south, white and holding a skull and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: 'jigs byed dang /_kha tam ga'i srin po dang /_tshhogs kyi dbang phyug dang / dril bu'i rnam pa can rnams dkar po'o/_/byang du gtum mo'i dbang phyug dang mdun pa'i lha dang /_rigs kyi dbang phyug dang smra ba'i 'jigs byed rnams
analyzed: 'jigs byed dang /_kha tam ga'i srin po dang /_tshhogs kyi dbang phyug dang / dril bu'i rnam pa can rnams dkar po'o/_/byang du gtum mo'i dbang phyug dang mdun pa'i lha dang /_rigs kyi dbang phyug dang smra ba'i 'jigs byed rnams
translated: In the west is red Mahābala, in the east is black Mahābhairava, and in the north is white Caṇḍa.🔽On the western petal, Caṇḍa is in the west, red and holding a skull and a khaṭvāṅga.🔽In the north is white Mahābala, in the south is black Mahābhairava, and in the east is red Caṇḍa.🔽On the northern petal, Caṇḍa is in the north, black and holding a skull and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: ser po'o/_/nub du 'dod pa drag po dang /_gtum mo'i dbang phyug dang / da ma ru'i 'dul byed dang /_rnga sgras 'jigs byed rnams dmar po'o/_/lhor🔽gtum bu ri'i dbang phyug dang /_tho ra na tha dang /_mche ba brtshigs pa dang / gzhu 'dzin ma rnams nag po dang /_nyi shu rtsha bzhi po 'di rnams ni/_khyab
analyzed: ser po'o/_/nub du 'dod pa drag po dang /_gtum mo'i dbang phyug dang / da ma ru'i 'dul byed dang /_rnga sgras 'jigs byed rnams dmar po'o/_/lhor🔽gtum bu ri'i dbang phyug dang /_tho ra na tha dang /_mche ba brtshigs pa dang / gzhu 'dzin ma rnams nag po dang /_nyi shu rtsha bzhi po 'di rnams ni/_khyab
translated: In the east is red Mahābala, in the south is white Mahābhairava, and in the west is black Caṇḍa.

original: 'jug la sogs pa zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa spyan gsum pa/_g.yas pa'i phyag
analyzed: 'jug la sogs pa zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa spyan gsum pa/_g.yas pa'i phyag
translated: The entering and so forth [vajra] yoginīs have one face, four arms, and three eyes.

original: gnyis kyis kha tam kha dang tri shul 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis thod pa dang bcas
analyzed: gnyis kyis kha tam kha dang tri shul 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis thod pa dang bcas
translated: The two right hands hold a khaṭvāṅga and a trident, and the two left hands hold skull cups

original: pa ste lha mo la mkhyud pa/_ral pa nag po'i thor tshhugs can/_thod pa lnga'i
analyzed: pa ste lha mo la mkhyud pa/_ral pa nag po'i thor tshhugs can/_thod pa lnga'i
translated: with human heads. They embrace the goddesses. They have topknots of black hair,

original: phreng bas dbu la brgyan pa/_phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa/_stag gi lpags pa'i na
analyzed: phreng bas dbu la brgyan pa/_phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa/_stag gi lpags pa'i na
translated: are adorned with head ornaments of garlands of five dried skulls, have the five symbolic ornaments, and wear tiger-skin skirts.

original: bza' dang ldan pa'o/_/'di dag gi lha mo rnams kyang g.yas pa na kha tam ga dang / g.yon pa na thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/'dir dpal rnal 'byor nam mkha' la ni mi
analyzed: bza' dang ldan pa'o/_/'di dag gi lha mo rnams kyang g.yas pa na kha tam ga dang / g.yon pa na thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/'dir dpal rnal 'byor nam mkha' la ni mi
translated: The goddesses also hold khaṭvāṅgas in their right hands and skull cups in their left hands.

original: bskyod pa la sogs pa de ba lngas rgyas btab pa/_ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ba la ni
analyzed: bskyod pa la sogs pa de ba lngas rgyas btab pa/_ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ba la ni
translated: Here, in the sky of glorious yoga, Akṣobhya and so forth are the seals of the five families.

original: mi bskyod pa'am rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa'o/_/rdo rje mkha' 'gro
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'am rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa'o/_/rdo rje mkha' 'gro
translated: In the sky of the gnosis ḍākinīs, Akṣobhya or Vairocana is the seal.🔽In the sky of the vajra ḍākinīs,

original: ma la sogs pa bzhi ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba
analyzed: ma la sogs pa bzhi ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba
translated: The four beginning with Mā are Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa rnams kyis so/_/seng ge ma la sogs pa bzhi
analyzed: mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa rnams kyis so/_/seng ge ma la sogs pa bzhi
translated: Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi. The four beginning with Siṃhamā are

original: ni mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen dbang phyug dang snang ba🔽mtha' yas rnams kyis so/_/tshhangs pa la rnam par snang mdzad kyis so/_/
analyzed: ni mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen dbang phyug dang snang ba mtha' yas rnams kyis so/_/tshhangs pa la rnam par snang mdzad kyis so/_/
translated: Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, and Amitābha.🔽Brahmā is Vairocana.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Garland of Yoga Perfections, the Means of Achieving All Maṇḍalas

original: dbang phyug chen po la snang ba mtha' yas kyis so/_/gzhan lha dkar po rnams kyi
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la snang ba mtha' yas kyis so/_/gzhan lha dkar po rnams kyi
translated: Maheśvara is Amitābha. The other white deities are Vairocana.

original: ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis so/_/ser po rnams ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyis so//
analyzed: ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis so/_/ser po rnams ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyis so//
translated: The yellow ones are Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: dmar po rnams ni snang ba mtha' yas kyis so/_/nag po rnams ni mi bskyod pa'o//
analyzed: dmar po rnams ni snang ba mtha' yas kyis so/_/nag po rnams ni mi bskyod pa'o//
translated: The red ones are Amitābha. The black ones are Akṣobhya.

original: dal dbang phyug gi thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/om hum haswa ha/_zhes bya ba🔽ni snying po'i sngags so/_/om g+hu g+ha swa ha/_ro langs ma'i las thams cad byed
analyzed: dal dbang phyug gi thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/om hum haswa ha/_zhes bya ba ni snying po'i sngags so/_/om g+hu g+ha swa ha/_ro langs ma'i las thams cad byed
translated: The seed syllable in the heart of Maṇḍaleśvara is hūṃ.🔽Om hūṃ hasva ha is the essence mantra.

original: pa'i sngags so/_/zhes rim pa gsum ldan gyi dkyil 'khor ro//_//
analyzed: pa'i sngags so/_/zhes rim pa gsum ldan gyi dkyil 'khor ro//_//
translated: Om ghu gha sva ha is the mantra that accomplishes all the activities of Vetālī.

original: bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed kyi dal du/_rdo rje gur gyi dbus su
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed kyi dal du/_rdo rje gur gyi dbus su
translated: In the maṇḍala of Bhagavat Yamāntaka, in the middle of the vajra tent,

original: chos 'byung gi lte bar gnas pa'i/_yang kha gcig la dbus kyi dal gzhal yas
analyzed: chos 'byung gi lte bar gnas pa'i/_yang kha gcig la dbus kyi dal gzhal yas
translated: in the center of the source of phenomena,🔽some explain that in the center of the maṇḍala, in the palace of the celestial mansion,

original: khang gi rim pa la/_mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi po rnams sgo rnams la bskyed
analyzed: khang gi rim pa la/_mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi po rnams sgo rnams la bskyed
translated: the four, such as dakini, are generated at the doors.

original: pa'i tshhul kyang bshad do/_/kha cig ni rim pa gnyis pa yang gzhal yas khang gi
analyzed: pa'i tshhul kyang bshad do/_/kha cig ni rim pa gnyis pa yang gzhal yas khang gi
translated: Some say that the second level is shaped like the celestial mansion.

original: dbyibs lta bu zer ro/_/de nyid kyang zlum por byed pa'i lugs kyang shes par
analyzed: dbyibs lta bu zer ro/_/de nyid kyang zlum por byed pa'i lugs kyang shes par
translated: One should also know that it is the system of making it round.

original: bya'o/_/gzhal yas khang gi dbus su sna tshhogs mtshho skyes dang nyi ma'i steng du
analyzed: bya'o/_/gzhal yas khang gi dbus su sna tshhogs mtshho skyes dang nyi ma'i steng du
translated: In the center of the celestial mansion, on a multicolored lotus and sun,

original: gnas pa'i ma he nag po khros pa rus brgyan gyis brgyan pa'i rgyab du sna tshhogs pad+ma🔽dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gshin rje'i steng du gshin rje gshed nag po g.yon bskyang
analyzed: gnas pa'i ma he nag po khros pa rus brgyan gyis brgyan pa'i rgyab du sna tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gshin rje'i steng du gshin rje gshed nag po g.yon bskyang
translated: On top of the black buffalo upon which he stands, which is fierce and adorned with bone ornaments, is a multicolored lotus and sun seat upon which is Yama.

original: g.yas bskum pa/_rma ra dmar skya/_dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa/🔽rdo rje'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_thung zhing sbom pa gsus pa 'phyang ba/_mi mgo'i
analyzed: g.yas bskum pa/_rma ra dmar skya/_dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa/ rdo rje'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_thung zhing sbom pa gsus pa 'phyang ba/_mi mgo'i
translated: Upon him is black Yamantaka, with his left leg extended and right leg drawn in, with tawny hair streaming upward,🔽adorned with bone ornaments, short and stout with a hanging belly,

original: phreng ba 'gul du 'chang ba/_ljags 'dril ba/_'bar ba'i mche ba brtshigs pa/
analyzed: phreng ba 'gul du 'chang ba/_ljags 'dril ba/_'bar ba'i mche ba brtshigs pa/
translated: wearing a garland of human heads, with a curled tongue, and with blazing fangs.

original: rtsha ba dang g.yas g.yon gyi zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar ba'o/_/phyag
analyzed: rtsha ba dang g.yas g.yon gyi zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar ba'o/_/phyag
translated: His right, left, and rear faces are black, white, and red.

original: drug pa'i gri gug dang thod pas mchod par byas pa'i g.yas dang gcig shos kyi
analyzed: drug pa'i gri gug dang thod pas mchod par byas pa'i g.yas dang gcig shos kyi
translated: He is six-armed, holding flaying knives and skull cups in his first two right hands and making the threatening gesture and the boon-granting gesture with the other two.

original: phyag gnyis kyis bdag dang mtshhungs pa'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/_gzhan
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis bdag dang mtshhungs pa'i shes rab ma la mkhyud pa/_gzhan
translated: He embraces the wisdom-consort Prajnaparamita, who is similar to himself, with his two remaining hands.

original: g.yas pa gnyis na rdo rje dang ral gri 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon pa gnyis na 'khor lo🔽dang pad+ma 'dzin pa/_mtha' yas la sogs pa'i klus brgyan pa ni lo ga gsum
analyzed: g.yas pa gnyis na rdo rje dang ral gri 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon pa gnyis na 'khor lo dang pad+ma 'dzin pa/_mtha' yas la sogs pa'i klus brgyan pa ni lo ga gsum
translated: The two right hands hold a vajra and a sword, and the two left hands hold a wheel and a lotus.🔽He is adorned with the nāgas Ananta and so forth, like the one who is victorious over the three worlds.

original: las rnam par rgyal ba bzhin du'o/_/'di'i shar du gti mug gshin rje gshed
analyzed: las rnam par rgyal ba bzhin du'o/_/'di'i shar du gti mug gshin rje gshed
translated: To the east of him is white Delusion Yamāntaka,🔽with a wrathful face and the right and other faces white, black, and red.

original: dkar po ste/_rtsha ba'i zhal dang g.yas dang gcig shos kyi zhal dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'o/_/phyag g.yas pa gnyis na 'khor lo dang ral gri/
analyzed: dkar po ste/_rtsha ba'i zhal dang g.yas dang gcig shos kyi zhal dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'o/_/phyag g.yas pa gnyis na 'khor lo dang ral gri/
translated: The two right hands hold a wheel and a sword, and the two left hands hold a jewel and a lotus.

original: g.yon gyi phyag gnyis na rin po che dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/lho phyogs su phra ma gshin rje
analyzed: g.yon gyi phyag gnyis na rin po che dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/lho phyogs su phra ma gshin rje
translated: To the south is Jealousy Yamāntaka,

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gser gyi mdog lta bu zhal gsum pa/_ser po dang sngon po
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gser gyi mdog lta bu zhal gsum pa/_ser po dang sngon po
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava, the color of gold, with three faces—yellow, blue, and white.

original: dang dkar po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na rin po che dang ral gri/_g.yon pa
analyzed: dang dkar po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na rin po che dang ral gri/_g.yon pa
translated: The two right hands hold a jewel and a sword, and the two left hands hold a lotus and a wheel.

original: gnyis na 'khor lo dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du 'dod chags gshin rje gshed snang ba
analyzed: gnyis na 'khor lo dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du 'dod chags gshin rje gshed snang ba
translated: In the west is Passion Yamāntaka,

original: mtha' yas dmar po ste/_zhal gsum pa/_dmar po dang nag po dang dkar
analyzed: mtha' yas dmar po ste/_zhal gsum pa/_dmar po dang nag po dang dkar
translated: red Amitābha, with three faces—red, black, and white—

original: po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na pad+ma dang ral gri/_g.yon gyi phyag gnyis na
analyzed: po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na pad+ma dang ral gri/_g.yon gyi phyag gnyis na
translated: and six arms. The two right hands hold a lotus and sword, and the two left hands🔽hold a jewel and wheel.

original: nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du phrag dog gshin rje gshed ljang khu ste/
analyzed: nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du phrag dog gshin rje gshed ljang khu ste/
translated: In the north is Jealousy Yamāntaka, green,

original: zhal gsum pa ljang khu dang nag po dang dkar po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na
analyzed: zhal gsum pa ljang khu dang nag po dang dkar po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis na
translated: with three faces—green, black, and white—🔽and six arms. The two right hands hold a sword and wheel, and the two left

original: ral gri dang 'khor lo/_g.yon gnyis na nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/'khro
analyzed: ral gri dang 'khor lo/_g.yon gnyis na nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/'khro
translated: hands hold a jewel and lotus.

original: bo bzhi po 'di dag ni dal gyi bdag po'i mtshhan nyid can/_phyag g.yas g.yon
analyzed: bo bzhi po 'di dag ni dal gyi bdag po'i mtshhan nyid can/_phyag g.yas g.yon
translated: These four wrathful ones have the characteristics of the lords of the maṇḍala,

original: gyi dang po gnyis kyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas bdag nyid lta bu'i yid du
analyzed: gyi dang po gnyis kyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas bdag nyid lta bu'i yid du
translated: and the first two hands hold a flaying knife and skull cup, like one’s own🔽mind.

original: 'ong ba la mkhyud pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su rdo rje tshar tshi ka skem mo gzugs dang phyag mtshhan rnams ni gti mug gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/bden bral gyi
analyzed: 'ong ba la mkhyud pa'o/_/me'i mtshhams su rdo rje tshar tshi ka skem mo gzugs dang phyag mtshhan rnams ni gti mug gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/bden bral gyi
translated: In the east, in the space of fire, is Vajra Tsiknamo, with the form and hand implements of Delusion Yamantaka.

original: mtshhams su rdo rje phag mo/_phag mo'i zhal/_zhe sdang gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/🔽rlung gi mtshhams su rdo rje dbyangs can ma 'dod chags gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/
analyzed: mtshhams su rdo rje phag mo/_phag mo'i zhal/_zhe sdang gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/ rlung gi mtshhams su rdo rje dbyangs can ma 'dod chags gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/
translated: In the southwest, in the space of Brahma, is Vajra Varahi, with the face of Varahi and the form and hand implements of Aversion Yamantaka.🔽In the northwest, in the space of Rudra, is Vajra Sarasvati, with the form and hand implements of Desire Yamantaka.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshhams su g+ho ri ma phrag dog gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/'dir
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshhams su g+ho ri ma phrag dog gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/'dir
translated: In the northeast, in the space of Ishvara, is Ghoridari, with the form and hand implements of Jealousy Yamantaka.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ni rdo rje rgya gram gyi rtshibs kyi rtsha rnams la'o/_/
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ni rdo rje rgya gram gyi rtshibs kyi rtsha rnams la'o/_/
translated: Here, in the garland of perfect yoga, the sadhana of all mandalas is complete.🔽Vairochana and so forth are on the spokes of the vajra cross.

original: rdo rje ra'i mtshhams bzhi rdo rje tshar tshi ka la sogs pa bzhi ni bdag nyid lta bu'i
analyzed: rdo rje ra'i mtshhams bzhi rdo rje tshar tshi ka la sogs pa bzhi ni bdag nyid lta bu'i
translated: The four corners of the vajra enclosure are the four vajra goddesses, Tsiknamo and so forth, who are similar to oneself.

original: thabs la mkhyud pa'o/_/shar sgor tho ba gshin rje gshed nag po zhal gsum pa ste/
analyzed: thabs la mkhyud pa'o/_/shar sgor tho ba gshin rje gshed nag po zhal gsum pa ste/
translated: He is embraced by his method.🔽At the eastern gate is Black Hammer Yamāntaka, with three faces.

original: nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje tho ba
analyzed: nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'o/_/g.yas kyi phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje tho ba
translated: His two right hands hold a vajra hammer

original: dang ral gri 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: dang ral gri 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis nor bu dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: and a sword, and his two left hands hold a jewel and a lotus.

original: lho'i sgor dbyug tho gshin rje gshed dkar po dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar🔽po'o/_/zhal gsum pa/_g.yas pa gnyis dbyug pa dang ral gri/_g.yon pa
analyzed: lho'i sgor dbyug tho gshin rje gshed dkar po dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po'o/_/zhal gsum pa/_g.yas pa gnyis dbyug pa dang ral gri/_g.yon pa
translated: At the southern gate is White Club Yamāntaka, with three faces.🔽His two right hands hold a club and a sword, and his two left hands hold a lotus and a wheel.

original: gnyis pad+ma dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/nub sgor pad+ma gshin rje gshed 'dod
analyzed: gnyis pad+ma dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/nub sgor pad+ma gshin rje gshed 'dod
translated: At the western gate is Passion Lotus Yamāntaka,🔽like Passion Yamāntaka.

original: chags gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/byang sgor ral gri gshin rje gshed phrag dog
analyzed: chags gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/byang sgor ral gri gshin rje gshed phrag dog
translated: At the northern gate is Envy Sword Yamāntaka,

original: gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/khyad par cung zad sngo ba shas che ba'o/_/thams
analyzed: gshin rje gshed lta bu'o/_/khyad par cung zad sngo ba shas che ba'o/_/thams
translated: like Envy Yamāntaka.

original: cad ni klu ma rungs pas brgyan pas 'jigs par byed pa/_dgyes pa'i gad mo
analyzed: cad ni klu ma rungs pas brgyan pas 'jigs par byed pa/_dgyes pa'i gad mo
translated: All of them are terrifying because they are adorned with nāgas.🔽They laugh with delight.

original: can/_dbu skra dmar po gyen la brdzes shing /_mche ba brtshigs pa'i zhal can/🔽phyag gi gtsho bo gnyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas bdag dang mtshhungs pa'i
analyzed: can/_dbu skra dmar po gyen la brdzes shing /_mche ba brtshigs pa'i zhal can/ phyag gi gtsho bo gnyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas bdag dang mtshhungs pa'i
translated: He has a face with bared fangs and upward-streaming red hair.

original: shes rab la mkhyud pa'o/_/'dir ni rnam par snang mdzad dang lha mo rnams ni sna🔽tshhogs pad+ma dang zla ba la gnas pa'o/_/lha gzhan rnams ni sna tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi
analyzed: shes rab la mkhyud pa'o/_/'dir ni rnam par snang mdzad dang lha mo rnams ni sna tshhogs pad+ma dang zla ba la gnas pa'o/_/lha gzhan rnams ni sna tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi
translated: His two sets of hands hold a flaying knife and a skull cup, and he embraces the wisdom-being Prajñāpāramitā, who is similar to himself.🔽Here, Vairocana and the goddesses are on variegated lotuses and moon seats,

original: ma la gnas pa'o/_/dal gyi me la sogs pa'i mtshhams bzhi la sna tshhogs pad+ma la
analyzed: ma la gnas pa'o/_/dal gyi me la sogs pa'i mtshhams bzhi la sna tshhogs pad+ma la
translated: while the other deities are on variegated lotuses and sun seats.

original: gnas pa'i thod pa bzhi ni byang chub kyi sems dkar po dang khrag dang bdud rtshi lnga
analyzed: gnas pa'i thod pa bzhi ni byang chub kyi sems dkar po dang khrag dang bdud rtshi lnga
translated: The four corners of the maṇḍala have variegated lotuses with four skull cups filled with white bodhicitta, blood, the five elixirs,🔽and a lamp.

original: dang mar mes bkang ba'o/_/bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bdag po ni gshin rje
analyzed: dang mar mes bkang ba'o/_/bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bdag po ni gshin rje
translated: The Bhagavān is the lord of the family, Yamāntaka,

original: gshed nyid do/_/rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi yang de bzhin no/_/
analyzed: gshed nyid do/_/rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi yang de bzhin no/_/
translated: and the four, Vairocana and so on, are the same.

original: de rnams ni go rims ji lta bar tshar tshi ka la sogs pa bzhi dang /_tho ba gshin
analyzed: de rnams ni go rims ji lta bar tshar tshi ka la sogs pa bzhi dang /_tho ba gshin
translated: Those should be understood to be the four, such as Caṇḍa, and the four, such as Yama Slayer.

original: rje gshed la sogs pa 'di rnams la'ang shes par bya'o/_/bcom ldan 'das kyi🔽thugs kyi sa bon ni yo ngo /_/om hrihhrih_bi kri ta na na hum phat/_zhes bya ba ni snying
analyzed: rje gshed la sogs pa 'di rnams la'ang shes par bya'o/_/bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi sa bon ni yo ngo /_/om hrihhrih_bi kri ta na na hum phat/_zhes bya ba ni snying
translated: The seed syllable of the Bhagavat’s mind is yo.🔽Om hrīḥ hrīḥ vikṛtānana huṃ phaṭ is the essence mantra and the mantra for all activities.

original: po'i sngags dang las thams cad pa'i sngags so/_/dal 'di la thig bzhi btab pas le tshhe dgur
analyzed: po'i sngags dang las thams cad pa'i sngags so/_/dal 'di la thig bzhi btab pas le tshhe dgur
translated: In this maṇḍala, it is asserted that by drawing four lines, there are nine chambers;🔽it is asserted that there is a vajra fence; it is asserted that there are four corners;

original: 'dod pa yang yod/_rdo rje'i ra'i rtsha bar 'dod pa yang yod/_gru bzhi phyogs mtshhams su 'dod pa yang yod/_lha snam
analyzed: 'dod pa yang yod/_rdo rje'i ra'i rtsha bar 'dod pa yang yod/_gru bzhi phyogs mtshhams su 'dod pa yang yod/_lha snam
translated: it is asserted that there is a single base for the deities;🔽and it is asserted that all are male-female.

original: rkyang par 'dod pa yang yod/_thams cad yab yum du 'dod pa yang yod/_de yang yab gti mug rdo rje'i sar yum tshar tshi
analyzed: rkyang par 'dod pa yang yod/_thams cad yab yum du 'dod pa yang yod/_de yang yab gti mug rdo rje'i sar yum tshar tshi
translated: Moreover, if Caṇḍālī arises on the stage of the male-female of ignorance, the male embraces the female;

original: ka byung na yab kyis yum la 'khyud/_yum gyi sar yab byung nas yum gyi yab la 'khyud pa'o/
analyzed: ka byung na yab kyis yum la 'khyud/_yum gyi sar yab byung nas yum gyi yab la 'khyud pa'o/
translated: if the male arises on the stage of the female, the female embraces the male.

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i dal bla ma a bya ka ra'i bzhed pa yin la/_rdo rje gur gyi nang du chos
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i dal bla ma a bya ka ra'i bzhed pa yin la/_rdo rje gur gyi nang du chos
translated: The mandala of Vajra Tara is the tradition of Guru Abhyakara.

original: 'byung gi dbus su gzhal yas khang gi lte ba la/_sna tshhogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad
analyzed: 'byung gi dbus su gzhal yas khang gi lte ba la/_sna tshhogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad
translated: In the Vajra Tent, in the center of the source of phenomena, in the center of the mandala base, is an eight-petaled multicolored lotus.

original: pa'i lte ba la bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje sgrol ma gser btsho ma lta bu/_sangs rgyas
analyzed: pa'i lte ba la bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje sgrol ma gser btsho ma lta bu/_sangs rgyas
translated: In the center of that is Bhagavati Vajra Tara, the color of molten gold, with crowns of the five buddhas.

original: lnga'i cod pan can/_zhal bzhi pa rtsha ba'i zhal dang /_g.yas dang /_nub dang / byang rnams gser gyi mdog dang dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po'o/_/phyag
analyzed: lnga'i cod pan can/_zhal bzhi pa rtsha ba'i zhal dang /_g.yas dang /_nub dang / byang rnams gser gyi mdog dang dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po'o/_/phyag
translated: She has four faces: the eastern face is yellow, the southern face is white, the western face is golden, the northern face is blue, and the upper face is red.

original: brgyad kyi g.yas rnams kyis rdo rje dang zhags pa dang mda' dang dung 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: brgyad kyi g.yas rnams kyis rdo rje dang zhags pa dang mda' dang dung 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: Of her eight arms, the right hands hold a vajra, lasso, arrow, and conch.

original: g.yon pa rnams kyis ut+pal ser po dang gzhu dang lcags kyu dang sdigs 'dzub
analyzed: g.yon pa rnams kyis ut+pal ser po dang gzhu dang lcags kyu dang sdigs 'dzub
translated: The left hands hold a yellow utpala, bow, hook, and threatening gesture.

original: mdzad pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar me tog ma dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis me tog gi
analyzed: mdzad pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar me tog ma dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis me tog gi
translated: On the eastern petal is white Pushpa, holding a flower in her two hands.

original: phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor spos kyi sgrol ma nag mo phyag gnyis kyis bdug spos
analyzed: phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor spos kyi sgrol ma nag mo phyag gnyis kyis bdug spos
translated: In the south is black Incense Tārā, holding incense in her two🔽hands.

original: 'dzin pa/_nub du mar me'i sgrol ma ser mo mar me yu ba dang bcas pa phyag
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_nub du mar me'i sgrol ma ser mo mar me yu ba dang bcas pa phyag
translated: In the west is yellow Lamp Tārā, holding a lamp with a handle in her🔽two hands.🔽In the north is yellow-green Scent Tārā, holding a conch of scent in her

original: gnyis kyis 'dzin pa/_byang du dri'i sgrol ma ljang ser phyag gnyis kyis dri chab kyi
analyzed: gnyis kyis 'dzin pa/_byang du dri'i sgrol ma ljang ser phyag gnyis kyis dri chab kyi
translated: two hands.

original: dung 'degs pa'o/_/lha mo bzhi po 'di dag ni zla ba la gnas pa'o/_/me la
analyzed: dung 'degs pa'o/_/lha mo bzhi po 'di dag ni zla ba la gnas pa'o/_/me la
translated: These four goddesses stand on moon discs.🔽On the petals of the fire and so forth are a wheel, a vajra, a lotus, and a

original: sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mdog lta bu'i🔽'khor lo dang rdo rje dang pad+ma dang ral gri'o/_/rim pa gnyis pa'i shar sgor rdo
analyzed: sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mdog lta bu'i 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang pad+ma dang ral gri'o/_/rim pa gnyis pa'i shar sgor rdo
translated: sword, the colors of Vairocana and so forth.🔽At the eastern gate of the second level is white Vajra Hook, holding a🔽hook in her right hand.

original: rje lcags kyu ma dkar mo g.yas pa na lcags kyu 'dzin pa/_lhor rdo rje zhags pa
analyzed: rje lcags kyu ma dkar mo g.yas pa na lcags kyu 'dzin pa/_lhor rdo rje zhags pa
translated: At the southern gate is yellow Vajra noose, holding a noose in her right🔽hand.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Garland of the Perfected Yoga: The Sādhana of All Mandalas

original: ma ser mo phyag g.yas kyis zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du rdo rje lcags sgrog ma🔽dmar mo phyag g.yas na lcags sgrog gis mtshhan pa'o/_/byang du rdo rje dril bu ma
analyzed: ma ser mo phyag g.yas kyis zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dmar mo phyag g.yas na lcags sgrog gis mtshhan pa'o/_/byang du rdo rje dril bu ma
translated: In the west is Vajra-Lokeśvara,🔽red, holding a chain in her right hand.🔽In the north is Vajra-Ghaṇṭā,🔽green, holding a vajra-handled bell in her right hand.

original: ljang khu phyag g.yas pa rdo rje dril bus mtshhan pa'o/_/me la sogs pa'i mtshhams
analyzed: ljang khu phyag g.yas pa rdo rje dril bus mtshhan pa'o/_/me la sogs pa'i mtshhams
translated: In the southeast and so on are the various goddesses: Locanā is in the east on a multicolored lotus,🔽holding a vase of bodhicitta.🔽In the southeast is Māmakī,🔽holding a mountain.

original: rnams su ni sna tshhogs pad+ma rnams la spyan ma la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas byang
analyzed: rnams su ni sna tshhogs pad+ma rnams la spyan ma la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas byang

analyzed: rnams kyis pad+ma dang bcas pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya dang /_mda' dang rdo rje

analyzed: dang ral gri'o/_/g.yon pa rnams kyis sdigs 'dzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa

analyzed: kyis rma bya'i mjug sgro dang mda' dang mchog sbyin dang ral gri'o//_//

analyzed: mtshhams su dus mtshhan sku mdog nag mo lag pa gnyis kyis dung 'dzin pa'o/_/

analyzed: mdog dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis tri shul 'dzin pa'o/_/bzhi po 'di rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'o/_/dgu po 'di rnams ni rin po che sna tshhogs kyi rgyan

analyzed: dang gos dang rin po che'i cod pan dang /_zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum pa/

analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang /_rnam par snang mdzad dang /

analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang /_snang ba mtha' yas dang /_don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang /_rin chen 'byung ldan dang /_snang ba mtha' yas dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa'o/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgor sna tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma la rdo rje lcags kyu ma dang /_rdo rje zhags pa ma dang /_rdo
translated: The seals of Akṣobhya, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Vairocana.🔽At the eastern gate, etc., on variegated lotus and sun [discs], are Vajra Hook, Vajra Noose,

analyzed: rje lcags sgrog ma dang /_rdo rje dril bu ma rnams gong bzhin du'o/_/
translated: Vajra Chain, and Vajra Bell, as before.

analyzed: so sor 'brang ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon pre mo/_/a+o~m ma ni d+ha ri badzra
translated: The seed of the various [goddesses] such as Pṛthivi is preṃ.🔽Oṃ maṇi-dhara vajra-netra mahā-prati-sāra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

analyzed: ni ma ha pra ti swa re hu~m hu~m phat phat swa ha zhes pa ni snying po'o/_/stong chen

analyzed: mo'i sa bon ni bru/_om ahma ha sa ha pra mar d+ha ni hum bye snying po'o/_/gsang
translated: Her seed is brūṃ.🔽Oṃ aham hasa pramarthani hūṃ is the essence.🔽The seed of the dhāraṇī-holder is hūṃ.

analyzed: sngags rjes su 'dzin pa'i sa bon ni hum/_a+o~m a ma ha man tra a nu pa ri ni hum hum/

original: snying po'o/_/bsil ba'i tshhal ma'i sa bon ni dzi/_om ahma ha shri ta ba ti dzi hum/🔽snying po'o/_/rma bya chen mo'i sa bon ni mam/_yam ma ha ma yu ri bir ra rnyi hum

translated: Oṃ aham hasritavati ji hūṃ is the essence.🔽The seed of Mahāmāyūrī is mam.

analyzed: hum phat phat swa ha/_snying po'o/_/gzhan 'di rnams kyi dal gyi dbang phyug ma

analyzed: ni gang dang gang dgos pas bya'o/_/dal dbang phyug ma'i sngags ni las

original: thams cad pa'i sngags so//_//
analyzed: thams cad pa'i sngags so//_//
translated: The mantra of the maṇḍalādhārinī is the mantra for all activities.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dal la ni rdo rje gur gyi nang du gling dang gling phran dang rgya
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dal la ni rdo rje gur gyi nang du gling dang gling phran dang rgya
translated: In the maṇḍala of Vajradhātu, inside the vajra tent, there are the seven continents and subcontinents

analyzed: mtshho bdun la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i ri rab kyi steng du gzhal yas khang

analyzed: ste/_de'i dbus su seng ge'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i ze'u 'bru la bcom ldan

analyzed: 'das rnam par snang mdzad dkar po rdo rje'i skyil krung gis gnas pa nyi ma'i rgyab

analyzed: yol can/_ral pa'i thor tshhugs can/_sangs rgyas lngas spras pa'i rin po che'i

analyzed: cod pan dang /_nor bus brgyan pa/_khyad par du gyur pa'i rin po che'i rgyan sna tshhogs dang /_gos dang ldan pa/_zhi ba/_zhal bzhi pa/_dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang khu'o/_/phyag brgyad pa/_g.yas pa dang g.yon
translated: and jewel ornaments, with various special precious ornaments,

analyzed: bsgrang phreng dang mda' 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang gzhu

analyzed: 'dzin pa'o/_/yang na 'di ni zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dkar po/

analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje dang bcas pa'i byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya 'dzin pa'o/_/

analyzed: g.yon pa'i khu tshhur las rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sdigs 'dzub langs pa la/_g.yas pa
translated: His left hand is in the threatening mudra of a vajra-holder, and his right hand

analyzed: rdo rje bzung nas byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya langs pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo
translated: holds a vajra and makes the gesture of supreme enlightenment.

original: rje sems ma sngon mo ni g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe lnga pa dmar po 'dzin pa/_g.yon🔽pas sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor rin chen rdo rje🔽ser po g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe lnga pa'i rtshe mor mtshhan pa'i rin po che 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: rje sems ma sngon mo ni g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe lnga pa dmar po 'dzin pa/_g.yon pas sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor rin chen rdo rje ser po g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe lnga pa'i rtshe mor mtshhan pa'i rin po che 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: On the petal to the east is blue Vajrasattva, who holds a five-pronged red vajra in his right hand and a lasso with a threatening mudra in his left.🔽To the south is yellow Ratnavajra, who holds a jewel marked with a five-pronged vajra in his right hand and makes a threatening mudra with his left.

original: g.yon pas sdigs par byed pa'i sdigs mdzub po/_/nub du chos kyi rdo rje dmar
analyzed: g.yon pas sdigs par byed pa'i sdigs mdzub po/_/nub du chos kyi rdo rje dmar
translated: To the west is red Dharmavajra, who holds a sword marked with a five-pronged vajra in his right hand and makes a threatening mudra with his left.🔽To the north is green Karmavajra, who holds a five-pronged vajra marked with a sword in his right hand and makes a threatening mudra with his left.

original: po g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe lnga pas mtshhan pa'i pad+ma 'dab brgyad pa dmar skya 'dzin
analyzed: po g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe lnga pas mtshhan pa'i pad+ma 'dab brgyad pa dmar skya 'dzin
translated: His right hand holds a red eight-petaled lotus marked with a five-pronged vajra.

original: pa'o/_/g.yon pas kyang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du las kyi rdo rje ma ljang khu
analyzed: pa'o/_/g.yon pas kyang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du las kyi rdo rje ma ljang khu
translated: His left hand also holds a lotus. In the north is green Karmavajra.

original: g.yas pas sna tshhogs rdo rje rtshe mo bcu gnyis pa de ba lnga'i mdog lta bu 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: g.yas pas sna tshhogs rdo rje rtshe mo bcu gnyis pa de ba lnga'i mdog lta bu 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: His right hand holds a multicolored vajra marked with twelve prongs, the color of the five meats.

original: g.yon pas sdigs mdzub sdigs par byed pa'o/_/de nas shar gyi phyogs su glang
analyzed: g.yon pas sdigs mdzub sdigs par byed pa'o/_/de nas shar gyi phyogs su glang
translated: His left hand makes a threatening gesture with a threatening forefinger.

original: po che'i dbang po'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar mi bskyod pa sngon po rdo rje skyil🔽krung gis gnas pa/_phyag g.yas kyis mthe bong dang gung mo'i rtshe mor rdo rje rtshe lnga
analyzed: po che'i dbang po'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar mi bskyod pa sngon po rdo rje skyil krung gis gnas pa/_phyag g.yas kyis mthe bong dang gung mo'i rtshe mor rdo rje rtshe lnga
translated: Next, in the east, upon the head of an elephant king, in the center of a multicolored lotus, is blue Akṣobhya, abiding in vajra posture.🔽His right hand holds a five-pronged vajra at the level of his forehead in the earth-touching gesture. His left hand is in the gesture of equipoise.

original: pa bzung nas sa gnon gyi tshhul byed cing g.yon pa'i phyag mnyam bzhag dang bcas pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po phyag g.yas pa'i
analyzed: pa bzung nas sa gnon gyi tshhul byed cing g.yon pa'i phyag mnyam bzhag dang bcas pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po phyag g.yas pa'i
translated: On the petal in the east is white Vajrasattva, holding a five-pronged vajra to his heart with his right hand.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽gung mos snying khar gyen du 'gying ba'i tshhul gyis rnal 'byor gyi rdo rje dang / g.yon pas nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i dril bu dkur brten pa'o/_/lhor rdo rje🔽rgyal po ser po ni g.yas par gnas pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu 'gugs pa'i tshhul byed
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ gung mos snying khar gyen du 'gying ba'i tshhul gyis rnal 'byor gyi rdo rje dang / g.yon pas nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i dril bu dkur brten pa'o/_/lhor rdo rje rgyal po ser po ni g.yas par gnas pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu 'gugs pa'i tshhul byed
translated: The Garland of Yoga Perfections: A Complete Sādhana for All Mandalas🔽The right hand is in the mudrā of the vajra of yoga, with the middle finger raised at the heart, and the left hand holds a bell to the hip with pride.

original: pa'i tshhul can/_g.yon pas zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/yang na phyag gnyis kyis
analyzed: pa'i tshhul can/_g.yon pas zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/yang na phyag gnyis kyis
translated: In the south, Vajra King is yellow. He makes the mudrā of summoning with the right hand, which holds a vajra hook, and the left hand holds a lasso.🔽Alternatively, some texts say that he holds a hook with both hands,

original: 'gugs par byed pa'i lcags kyu 'dzin pa zhes kyang kha gcig las gsungs so/_/🔽byang du nub zer rdo rje chags pa dmar po g.yon dang gcig shos rnam pa gnyis kyis
analyzed: 'gugs par byed pa'i lcags kyu 'dzin pa zhes kyang kha gcig las gsungs so/_/ byang du nub zer rdo rje chags pa dmar po g.yon dang gcig shos rnam pa gnyis kyis
translated: which is used to summon.🔽In the north, Vajra Passion is red. He holds a bow and arrow with his two hands,🔽one of which is the left hand and the other is the right hand.

original: gzhu dang mda' 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje legs pa mar gad kyi mdog
analyzed: gzhu dang mda' 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje legs pa mar gad kyi mdog
translated: In the west, Vajra Excellent is the color of emerald.

original: lta bu rdo rje dang bcas pa'i phyag gnyis kyis snying khar legs so sbyin pa'i tshhul du
analyzed: lta bu rdo rje dang bcas pa'i phyag gnyis kyis snying khar legs so sbyin pa'i tshhul du
translated: His two hands, which hold a vajra, are in the gesture of granting fearlessness at his heart.

original: byed pa'o/_/lho ru rta'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte ba la rin chen 'byung ldan
analyzed: byed pa'o/_/lho ru rta'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte ba la rin chen 'byung ldan
translated: In the south, on a horse, in the center of a multicolored lotus, is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ser po rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa/_g.yas pa rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i rin po che
analyzed: ser po rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa/_g.yas pa rdo rjes mtshhan pa'i rin po che
translated: He is yellow and sits in the vajra posture. His right hand, which holds a jewel marked with a vajra,

original: gung mo la bzung ste mchog sbyin gyi tshhul du byed pa'o/_/g.yon pa de nyid kyi rtshar🔽gan rkyal du bzhag pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo rje rin chen ser po ni g.yas
analyzed: gung mo la bzung ste mchog sbyin gyi tshhul du byed pa'o/_/g.yon pa de nyid kyi rtshar gan rkyal du bzhag pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo rje rin chen ser po ni g.yas
translated: is in the gesture of granting wishes. His left hand rests in his lap in the gesture of meditative equipoise.🔽On the eastern petal is Vajraratna. He is yellow and holds a vajra fist to his right side.🔽He wears a garland of jewels marked with two vajras

original: pa'i rdo rje khu tshhur gyi phyogs gnyis la rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshhan pa'i rin po che'i
analyzed: pa'i rdo rje khu tshhur gyi phyogs gnyis la rdo rje gnyis kyis mtshhan pa'i rin po che'i
translated: at the place of consecration. His left hand holds a vajra bell🔽and he holds it with a playful gesture.

original: phreng ba dbang bskur gyi gnas su 'ching bar byed cing /_g.yon pa rdo rje dril🔽bu sgeg pa dang bcas pas 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor rdo rje gzi brjid dmar po phyag
analyzed: phreng ba dbang bskur gyi gnas su 'ching bar byed cing /_g.yon pa rdo rje dril🔽bu sgeg pa dang bcas pas 'dzin pa'o/_/lhor rdo rje gzi brjid dmar po phyag
translated: In the south is Vajratejas. He is red and holds a vajra fist to his right side.

original: gnyis kyis snying khar nyi ma gsal bar byed pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje
analyzed: gnyis kyis snying khar nyi ma gsal bar byed pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje
translated: The two hands at the heart center hold the sun, which illuminates.

original: me tog ljang khu g.yon gyi phyogs na gnas pa'i phyag gnyis yid bzhin gyi nor bus🔽mtshhan pa'i rgyal mtshhan 'phyar ba'o/_/byang du nub zer rdo rje bzhad pa dkar po🔽g.yas pas ba so'i phreng ba dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon pas kyang de
analyzed: me tog ljang khu g.yon gyi phyogs na gnas pa'i phyag gnyis yid bzhin gyi nor bus mtshhan pa'i rgyal mtshhan 'phyar ba'o/_/byang du nub zer rdo rje bzhad pa dkar po g.yas pas ba so'i phreng ba dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon pas kyang de
translated: In the west, the green Vajra Laughter of the Western Light holds a wish-fulfilling jewel in the two hands that are in the direction of the left.🔽The two hands hold a victory banner marked with a wish-fulfilling jewel.🔽In the north, the white Vajra Laughter of the Northern Light holds a vajra with a garland of pearls in the right hand.

original: bzhin du so'i phreng ba gnyis dang ldan pa'i rdo rje gnyis khar bcug pa'o/_/nub
analyzed: bzhin du so'i phreng ba gnyis dang ldan pa'i rdo rje gnyis khar bcug pa'o/_/nub
translated: The left hand also holds a vajra with two garlands of pearls placed in the mouth.

original: du rma bya'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i ze'u 'bru la snang ba mtha' yas dmar po rdo rje🔽dkyil dkrung can/_g.yon pa dang gcig shos gan rkyal du byas ste/_lte ba'i
analyzed: du rma bya'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i ze'u 'bru la snang ba mtha' yas dmar po rdo rje dkyil dkrung can/_g.yon pa dang gcig shos gan rkyal du byas ste/_lte ba'i
translated: In the west, on a peacock, on the anthers of a multicolored lotus, is red Amitābha in vajra posture.🔽The left and right hands are placed on the navel, lying face up and face down, respectively, in the mudra of samādhi.

original: thog du bzhag pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar
analyzed: thog du bzhag pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar
translated: On the petal in the east, on a multicolored lotus and moon, is white Vairocana.

original: rdo rje chos dmar skya/_g.yon pas 'gying bag dang bcas pas ud pa la'i yu🔽ba 'dzin zhing g.yas pas kha 'byed pa'o/_/lho ru rdo rje rin po che sngon po g.yon
analyzed: rdo rje chos dmar skya/_g.yon pas 'gying bag dang bcas pas ud pa la'i yu ba 'dzin zhing g.yas pas kha 'byed pa'o/_/lho ru rdo rje rin po che sngon po g.yon
translated: which he holds with a graceful bearing. He opens the flower with his right🔽hand.🔽In the south, Vajraratna is blue. He holds a wisdom-­mohavajra at his🔽heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.🔽In the west, Vajrarāja is yellow. He holds a wisdom-­mohavajra at his

original: pas snying khar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i po ti 'dzin pa/_g.yas pas ral
analyzed: pas snying khar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i po ti 'dzin pa/_g.yas pas ral
translated: heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.🔽In the north, Vajratejah is red. He holds a wisdom-­mohavajra at his🔽heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.

original: gyi phyar ba'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje rgyu gser btsho ma'i mdog lta bu g.yon par🔽gnas pa'i 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad pa g.yas pa'i gung mos g+hal me lta bur skor🔽zhing chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du nub zer rdo rje smra ba dmar
analyzed: gyi phyar ba'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje rgyu gser btsho ma'i mdog lta bu g.yon par gnas pa'i 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad pa g.yas pa'i gung mos g+hal me lta bur skor zhing chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du nub zer rdo rje smra ba dmar
translated: In the northeast, Vajraviśva is green. He holds a wisdom-­mohavajra at🔽his heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.🔽In the southeast, Vajravikurvaṇa is yellow. He holds a wisdom-­mohavajra🔽at his heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.

original: po g.yon pa chos kyi dung g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe gcig pa'i rtshe mo 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: po g.yon pa chos kyi dung g.yas pas rdo rje rtshe gcig pa'i rtshe mo 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: In the southwest, Vajraprabha is red. He holds a wisdom-­mohavajra at🔽his heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.🔽In the northwest, Vajrahetu is the color of molten gold. He holds a

original: byang du khyung gi steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar don yod grub pa ljang khu skyil krung
analyzed: byang du khyung gi steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar don yod grub pa ljang khu skyil krung
translated: wisdom-­mohavajra at his heart with his left hand and a jewel with his right.

original: gis gnas pa/_phyag g.yas pa'i gung mos sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pas mi
analyzed: gis gnas pa/_phyag g.yas pa'i gung mos sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pas mi
translated: He is standing with his right hand at his nose holding a vajra cross,

original: 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i tshhul byed cing /_g.yon pa lte ba'i 'og tu gan rkyal du🔽bzhag pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo rje las ljang khu g.yas pas snying khar sgreng
analyzed: 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i tshhul byed cing /_g.yon pa lte ba'i 'og tu gan rkyal du bzhag pa'o/_/shar gyi 'dab mar rdo rje las ljang khu g.yas pas snying khar sgreng
translated: in the gesture of granting fearlessness, and his left hand is placed on his🔽belly, palm up.🔽On the petal in the east is green Vajrakarma. He holds a vajra cross

original: ba'i sna tshhogs rdo rje rtshe mo bcu gnyis pa 'dzin pa/_g.yon pas sna tshhogs rdo rjes
analyzed: ba'i sna tshhogs rdo rje rtshe mo bcu gnyis pa 'dzin pa/_g.yon pas sna tshhogs rdo rjes
translated: erect at his heart with his right hand and a bell marked with a vajra cross🔽at his hip with his left.

original: mtshhan pa'i dril bu skur brten pa'o/_/yang na lag pa gnyis kyis spyi bor thal mo
analyzed: mtshhan pa'i dril bu skur brten pa'o/_/yang na lag pa gnyis kyis spyi bor thal mo
translated: Alternatively, he holds a vajra cross with his two hands at his crown,🔽palms together.

original: sbyar nas sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/lho ru rdo rje bsrung ba ser mo phyag gnyis🔽kyis rdo rje'i go cha 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje gnod sbyin nag po phyag
analyzed: sbyar nas sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/lho ru rdo rje bsrung ba ser mo phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje'i go cha 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du byang zer rdo rje gnod sbyin nag po phyag
translated: In the south is yellow Vajravarma. He holds a vajra armor with his two🔽hands.🔽In the west is black Vajrayakṣa. He holds the tips of his two pinkies in

original: gnyis kyi mthe'u chung gis rdo rje mche ba'i mtshhon gyi rtshe mo gnyis khar bcug pas
analyzed: gnyis kyi mthe'u chung gis rdo rje mche ba'i mtshhon gyi rtshe mo gnyis khar bcug pas
translated: his mouth, making the shape of a vajra fang.

original: gdug pa rnams bsdigs pa'o/_/byang du nub zer rdo rje khu tshhur khu tshhur gnyis kyis🔽bzung ba'i rdo rje'i rtshe mnan pa'o/_/dbus kyi rim pa'i me'i mtshhams kyi pad+ma la
analyzed: gdug pa rnams bsdigs pa'o/_/byang du nub zer rdo rje khu tshhur khu tshhur gnyis kyis bzung ba'i rdo rje'i rtshe mnan pa'o/_/dbus kyi rim pa'i me'i mtshhams kyi pad+ma la
translated: In the north, on the western petal, is Vajra Ghaṇṭā, holding a vajra with two fists.

original: rdo rje sgeg mo dkar mo rdo rje 'gying ba'i phyag rgyas phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje gnyis🔽dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽'dzin pa'o/_/bden bral gyi mtshhams su phreng ba ma ser mo phyag gnyis kyis rin
analyzed: rdo rje sgeg mo dkar mo rdo rje 'gying ba'i phyag rgyas phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje gnyis dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi bsgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ 'dzin pa'o/_/bden bral gyi mtshhams su phreng ba ma ser mo phyag gnyis kyis rin
translated: In the center, on the lotus in the southeast, is Vajra Lāsya, white, holding two vajras with the gesture of arrogance.🔽In the southwest is Vajra Māla, yellow, holding a jewel garland with two hands.

original: po che'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/rlung gis mtshhams kyi pad+ma la glu ma dmar mo phyag🔽gnyis kyis pi wang gi rgyud bsgreng ba'o/_/dbang ldan gyi pad+ma la gar ma ljang khu
analyzed: po che'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/rlung gis mtshhams kyi pad+ma la glu ma dmar mo phyag gnyis kyis pi wang gi rgyud bsgreng ba'o/_/dbang ldan gyi pad+ma la gar ma ljang khu
translated: In the northwest is Vajra Gītā, red, holding a lute with two hands.🔽In the northeast is Vajra Nṛtya, green, holding a three-pronged vajra with two hands and dancing.

original: phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje rtshe gsum pa bzung nas gyen du gar byed pa'o/_/dbus kyi
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje rtshe gsum pa bzung nas gyen du gar byed pa'o/_/dbus kyi
translated: In the center, on the lotus in the center, is Vajra Puṣpā, white, holding a flower with two hands.

original: gzhal yas khang gi phyi rol shar gyi snam bu'i 'dab ma la/_byams pa dang / mthong ba don yod dang /_ngan song kun 'dren dang /_mya ngan gyi mun pa
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi phyi rol shar gyi snam bu'i 'dab ma la/_byams pa dang / mthong ba don yod dang /_ngan song kun 'dren dang /_mya ngan gyi mun pa
translated: On the petals of the outer eastern walkway of the celestial mansion are Maitreya, Amoghasiddhi, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Sumbharaja.🔽

original: thams cad 'joms pa'i blo gros rnams ni mi bskyod pa lta bu'o/_/lho'i pad+ma🔽rnams la spos kyi glang po dang /_dpa' bar 'gro ba dang /_nam mkha' mdzod
analyzed: thams cad 'joms pa'i blo gros rnams ni mi bskyod pa lta bu'o/_/lho'i pad+ma rnams la spos kyi glang po dang /_dpa' bar 'gro ba dang /_nam mkha' mdzod
translated: On the petals of the outer eastern platform of the celestial mansion are Maitreya, Amoghasiddhi, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Sarvanagarottara Manjughosa, all of whom are like Akshobya.

original: dang /_ye shes tog rnams rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu'o/_/nub kyi pad+ma rnams🔽la 'od dpag med dang /_zla 'od dang /_bzang skyong dang /_dra ba'i 'od
analyzed: dang /_ye shes tog rnams rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu'o/_/nub kyi pad+ma rnams la 'od dpag med dang /_zla 'od dang /_bzang skyong dang /_dra ba'i 'od
translated: On the lotus petals of the south are Gandhahastin, Suvikramin, Gaganagañja, and Jnanaketu, all of whom are like Ratnasambhava.🔽On the lotus petals of the west are Amitabha, Candraprabha, Bhadrapāla, and Jālinīprabha, all of whom are like Amitābha.

original: rnams ni 'od dpag med lta bu'o/_/byang gi pad+ma rnams la rdo rje snying po dang / blo gros mi bzad pa dang /_spobs pa brtshegs pa dang kun tu bzang po rnams
analyzed: rnams ni 'od dpag med lta bu'o/_/byang gi pad+ma rnams la rdo rje snying po dang / blo gros mi bzad pa dang /_spobs pa brtshegs pa dang kun tu bzang po rnams
translated: On the lotus petals of the north are Vajragarbha, Akashagarbha, Sthiramati, and Samantabhadra, all of whom are like Amoghasiddhi.

original: don yod grub pa lta bu'o/_/yang na bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: don yod grub pa lta bu'o/_/yang na bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa'
translated: Alternatively, they are the bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon.

original: byams pa la sogs pa ste/_stong phrag gcig la bzhis ma tshhang ba bsgom par bya'o//
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa ste/_stong phrag gcig la bzhis ma tshhang ba bsgom par bya'o//
translated: Meditate on one thousand of each, minus four.

original: shar la sogs pa'i snam bu la de dag gi ming rnams ni brjod kyis mi lang bas🔽ma bshad do/_/me'i mtshhams kyi pad+ma la rdo rje bdug spos ma dkar mo dang / bden bral gyi mtshhams kyi pad+ma la rdo rje me tog ma ser mo dang /_rlung gi
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i snam bu la de dag gi ming rnams ni brjod kyis mi lang bas ma bshad do/_/me'i mtshhams kyi pad+ma la rdo rje bdug spos ma dkar mo dang / bden bral gyi mtshhams kyi pad+ma la rdo rje me tog ma ser mo dang /_rlung gi
translated: The names of those on the platforms of the east and so forth are not mentioned because they are inexpressible.

original: mtshhams kyi pad+ma la rdo rje mar me ma dkar dmar dang /_dbang ldan gyi mtshhams🔽kyi pad+mar rdo rje dri chab ma ljang khu'o/_/bdug spos ma la sogs pa 'di rnams ni
analyzed: mtshhams kyi pad+ma la rdo rje mar me ma dkar dmar dang /_dbang ldan gyi mtshhams kyi pad+mar rdo rje dri chab ma ljang khu'o/_/bdug spos ma la sogs pa 'di rnams ni
translated: On the lotus in the southeast is white Vajra Dhūpā, on the lotus in the southwest is yellow Vajra Puṣpā, on the lotus in the northwest is red Vajra Dīpa, and on the lotus in the northeast is green Vajra Gandhā.

original: gong bzhin du phyag mtshhan 'dzin pa'o/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams la rdo rje
analyzed: gong bzhin du phyag mtshhan 'dzin pa'o/_/shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams la rdo rje
translated: These Dhūpā and so forth hold their respective hand implements as above.

original: lcags kyu dang /_rdo rje zhags pa dang /_rdo rje lcags sgrog dang /_rdo rje 'bebs pa
analyzed: lcags kyu dang /_rdo rje zhags pa dang /_rdo rje lcags sgrog dang /_rdo rje 'bebs pa
translated: At the eastern gate and so forth are Vajra aṅkuśā, Vajra pāśā, Vajra śṛṅkhalā, and Vajra ghantā.

original: la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin du dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang khu
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin du dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang khu
translated: The colors of the deities are white, yellow, red, and green, respectively.

original: rnams kyis gong bzhin du phyag mtshhan 'dzin pa'o/_/'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo🔽rje dbyings las gzhan pa'i lha rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa/_gos dang rin

translated: White Lady of Power over Wealth is white with a red tinge and holds an image of Amitābha seated on a ruby lotus.🔽White Lady of Power over Mind holds a five-pronged red vajra.🔽Yellow Lady of Power over Resources holds a wish-fulfilling gem.

analyzed: tshun d+ha ma dkar mo spyi blugs la 'phyang ba'i bzlas pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/

analyzed: byang ljang khu zhes kyang gsung ngo /_/'khor lo'i lte ba la sna tshhogs pad+ma gnas

translated: In the center of the wheel is a multicolored lotus, and upon that is a lion throne, upon which is the Bhagavat Shakyasiṃha, Vairochana,🔽the color of gold, holding the mudra of turning the wheel of Dharma.🔽In the eastern spoke is white Vajroshṇīsha, with the mudra of touching the earth.

analyzed: kyi rtshibs la rin chen tshug tor sngon po mchod sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o/_/

analyzed: pa/_g.yon pa skur brten pa'o/_/bden bral mtshhams la gtshug tor rgyal

analyzed: bsangs/_phyag g.yas ral gri g.yon pas spo ti 'dzin pa'o/_/dbang ldan gyi

analyzed: dang /_phreng ba mo dang /_glu ma dang /_gar ma rnams sku mdog dkar mo

analyzed: dang ser mo dmar mo dang khra mo'o/_/phyag gnyis pa rnams so/_/sgo'i g.yon

analyzed: la brten pa'o/_/ngan song sbyong ba dkar po phyag gnyis kyis lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o//

analyzed: mya ngan gyi mun pa rnam par 'joms pa'i blo gros dkar ser 'dres pa'i mdog

analyzed: brten pa'o/_/lho phyogs kyi snam bu la spos kyi glang po dkar ljang /_g.yas

analyzed: pa skur brten pa'o/_/nub kyi snam bu la bdud rtshi 'od dkar po g.yas bdud

analyzed: g.yas pas pad+ma la gnas pa'i rin po che brtshegs pa 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa
translated: His right hand holds a jewel on a lotus, and his left hand rests on his hip.

original: mtshhams rnams la me tog ma dang /_bdug spos ma dang /_mar me ma dang / dri chab ma rnams ni dkar mo dang /_nag mo dang /_dmar mo dang /_ljang
analyzed: mtshhams rnams la me tog ma dang /_bdug spos ma dang /_mar me ma dang / dri chab ma rnams ni dkar mo dang /_nag mo dang /_dmar mo dang /_ljang
translated: The intermediate directions are occupied by the goddesses of the offerings: the white flower goddess, the black incense goddess, the red lamp goddess, and the green perfume goddess.

analyzed: khu rnams phyag gnyis kyis me tog la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgor rdo rje lcags kyu dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o/_/lho sgor rdo rje zhags pa sngon mo phyag gnyis kyis zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub du rdo rje lcags sgrog
translated: Each of them holds their respective offering in their two hands.🔽At the eastern gate is white Vajra Hook, holding a hook in her two hands.🔽At the southern gate is blue Vajra noose, holding a noose in her two hands.

original: dmar po phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje lcags sgrog 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du rdo rje 'bebs
analyzed: dmar po phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje lcags sgrog 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du rdo rje 'bebs
translated: At the western gate is red Vajra shackles, holding shackles in her two hands.🔽At the northern gate is green Vajra terrifier, holding a sword in her two hands.

original: pa ljang khu phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa'o/_/lha sum cu rtsha bdun po
analyzed: pa ljang khu phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa'o/_/lha sum cu rtsha bdun po
translated: The green Pāṇḍaravāsinī holds a vajra and a bell in her two hands.

original: 'di dag kyang gos sna tshhogs dang /_rin po che'i rgyan sna tshhogs kyis brgyan pa/🔽rin po che'i cod pan can spyan gsum pa/_phyag gnyis pa sna tshhogs pad+ma dang zla
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gos sna tshhogs dang /_rin po che'i rgyan sna tshhogs kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i cod pan can spyan gsum pa/_phyag gnyis pa sna tshhogs pad+ma dang zla
translated: These thirty-seven deities are adorned with various garments and various jewel ornaments.🔽They have jewel crowns, three eyes, two hands, and sit in sattva posture on multicolored lotuses and moon seats.

original: ba la sems dpa'i dkyil krung gis bzhugs pa'o/_/'dir rnam par snang mdzad
analyzed: ba la sems dpa'i dkyil krung gis bzhugs pa'o/_/'dir rnam par snang mdzad
translated: Here Vairocana is in the east,
